<SYSTEM>This is the full developer documentation for react-naver-maps-kit.</SYSTEM>

# Start of react-naver-maps-kit documentation

# React Naver Maps KIT

react-naver-maps-kit is a React binding for NAVER Maps JavaScript API v3.
It provides declarative map/overlay components, lifecycle-safe instance management, and TypeScript-first APIs.

This full document aggregates the official project docs for LLM consumption.
Main docs site: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/

## Primary Links

- Home: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/
- Getting Started: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/getting-started
- Core Concepts: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/core-concepts
- API Index (entry): https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/provider
- Examples Index (entry): https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/markers
- Troubleshooting: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/troubleshooting/common-issues
- Playground: https://react-naver-maps-kit-playground.pages.dev

---

# Full Documentation Sources


---

## Source File: index.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/
- Local Path: packages/docs/index.md


<style>
:root {
  --vp-home-hero-name-color: transparent;
  --vp-home-hero-name-background: -webkit-linear-gradient(120deg, #03C75A 30%, #1ec800);
  --vp-home-hero-image-background-image: linear-gradient(-45deg, #03C75A50 50%, #1ec80050 50%);
  --vp-home-hero-image-filter: blur(44px);
}

.VPHero .text {
  font-size: 24px !important;
  line-height: 1.3 !important;
}

.VPHero .image-bg {
  transition: filter 0.3s ease;
}

@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :root {
    --vp-home-hero-image-filter: blur(56px);
  }
  .VPHero .text {
    font-size: 28px !important;
  }
}

@media (min-width: 960px) {
  :root {
    --vp-home-hero-image-filter: blur(68px);
  }
  .VPHero .text {
    font-size: 32px !important;
  }
}
</style>

## Quick start

### installation

::: code-group

```bash [pnpm]
pnpm add react-naver-maps-kit
```

```bash [npm]
npm install react-naver-maps-kit
```

```bash [yarn]
yarn add react-naver-maps-kit
```

:::

### The first map

```tsx
import { NaverMapProvider, NaverMap, Marker } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId="your-client-id">
      <NaverMap
        defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        defaultZoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
      >
        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Custom Markers

```tsx
<Marker position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}>
  <div
    style={{
      padding: "8px 16px",
      background: "#03C75A",
      color: "white",
      borderRadius: "20px",
      fontWeight: "bold"
    }}
  >
Seoul City Hall
  </div>
</Marker>
```

## Component

### map

| component | Description |
| ---------------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| [`NaverMapProvider`](/api/provider) | SDK loading and authentication management |
| [`NaverMap`](/api/map) | map container |
| [`Panorama`](/guide/submodules/panorama) | street view |

###Overlay

| component | Description |
| ------------------------------------------ | ------------------------- |
| [`Marker`](/api/marker) | Marker (custom content support) |
| [`MarkerClusterer`](/api/marker-clusterer) | marker clustering |
| [`InfoWindow`](/api/info-window) | Information Window |
| [`Polyline`](/api/polyline) | line |
| [`Polygon`](/api/polygon) | polygon |
| [`Circle`](/api/circle) | won |
| [`Rectangle`](/api/rectangle) | square |

### Submodule

| Submodule | component |
| -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------- |
| [`panorama`](/guide/submodules/panorama)           | Panorama, FlightSpot |
| [`visualization`](/guide/submodules/visualization) | HeatMap, DotMap      |
| [`drawing`](/guide/submodules/drawing)             | DrawingManager       |
| [`gl`](/guide/submodules/gl) | GL vector map |

---

> **Disclaimer**: This library is not NAVER's official library.

---

## Source File: guide/getting-started.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/getting-started
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/getting-started.md

# Get started

This guide will guide you step by step through installing `react-naver-maps-kit` and creating your first map.

## Prerequisites

- React 18 or higher
- Node.js 18 or higher
- Naver Cloud Platform account (for API key issuance)

## Step 1: Installation

```bash
# pnpm (recommended)
pnpm add react-naver-maps-kit

# npm
npm install react-naver-maps-kit

# yarn
yarn add react-naver-maps-kit
```

### Peer Dependencies

This library requires the following packages as peer dependencies:

- `react >= 18`
- `react-dom >= 18`

### TypeScript support

This library is written in TypeScript and contains **complete type definitions**. To use the `naver.maps` global type, you must install `@types/navermaps` and set tsconfig.

#### 1. Install type package

```bash
# pnpm
pnpm add -D @types/navermaps

# npm
npm install -D @types/navermaps

# yarn
yarn add -D @types/navermaps
```

#### 2. tsconfig.json settings

Explicitly load the `navermaps` type by adding the `types` array to `compilerOptions`:

```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "types": ["vite/client", "navermaps"]
// ... other settings
  }
}
```

::: Why setting warning types is necessary
Newer module resolution methods, such as `moduleResolution: "bundler"`, may not automatically include `@types/*` packages. You must explicitly add `"navermaps"` to the `types` array for the `naver` global type to be recognized.
:::

#### 3. Example of type use

```tsx
import type { NaverMapRef, MarkerRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

// Use Naver Map SDK type
const handleMapReady = (map: naver.maps.Map) => {
  const center = map.getCenter();
console.log(`Map center: ${center.lat()}, ${center.lng()}`);
};
```

::: Tip extension type automatically applied
`react-naver-maps-kit` extends some types missing in `@types/navermaps`. When you import the library, extension types such as `map.isReady` and `HeatMap.addData()` are automatically applied.
:::

## Step 2: Issue an API key

1. Log in to [Naver Cloud Platform](https://www.ncloud.com/)
2. Apply for **Maps** service in console
3. Issue API key after **Application registration**

### Select key type

| key type | Prop | Use |
| ----------------- | ------------- | -------------- |
| NCP Key ID (recommended) | `ncpKeyId` | General Web Services |
| NCP Client ID | `ncpClientId` | Legacy Compatible |
| Gov Client ID | `govClientId` | For public institutions |
| Fin Client ID | `finClientId` | For financial institutions |

### Domain registration

In your development environment, add the following domains to your whitelist:

```
http://localhost:5173
http://localhost:3000
http://127.0.0.1:5173
```

## Step 3: Setting environment variables

If you are using Vite, create a `.env.local` file:

```env
VITE_NCP_KEY_ID=your-ncp-key-id-here
```

::: warning
Do not commit your API key to a public repository. Add `.env.local` to `.gitignore`.
:::

## Step 4: Provider settings

Wrap it with `NaverMapProvider` at the top level of your app:

```tsx
// App.tsx
import { NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider
      ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}
onReady={() => console.log("Map SDK is ready!")}
onError={(error) => console.error("SDK loading failed:", error)}
    >
{/* Map components go here */}
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}

export default App;
```

### Provider Options

| Prop | default | Description |
| ------------ | ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| `ncpKeyId`   | -       | NCP API Key ID                                                           |
| `submodules` | `[]` | Additional submodules (`geocoder`, `panorama`, `drawing`, `visualization`, `gl`) |
| `timeoutMs` | `10000` | SDK loading timeout (ms) |
| `autoLoad` | `true` | Automatic loading when mounted |
| `onReady` | - | SDK loading completion callback |
| `onError` | - | Error Occurrence Callback |

::: tip submodule guide
For instructions on how to use submodules, please refer to each guide:

- [Geocoder](/guide/submodules/geocoder) - Address search, coordinate conversion
- [Panorama](/guide/submodules/panorama) - street view, aerial view
- [Drawing](/guide/submodules/drawing) - Drawing tools
- [Visualization](/guide/submodules/visualization) - heat map, point map
- [GL](/guide/submodules/gl) - WebGL vector maps
  :::

## Step 5: Map Rendering

Display a map with the `NaverMap` component:

```tsx
// components/Map.tsx
import { NaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function Map() {
  return (
    <NaverMap
center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} // Seoul City Hall
      zoom={12}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    />
  );
}

export default Map;
```

### Required Props

- `center`: Map center coordinates (`{ lat: number, lng: number }`)
- `zoom`: Zoom level (1~21)
- `style`: map container size (CSS style)

::: tip
Map height must be specified. `height: 100%` alone does not work.
:::

## Step 6: Add markers

Mark a location on a map with the `Marker` component:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithMarker() {
  return (
    <NaverMap
      center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      zoom={14}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <Marker
        position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
title="Seoul City Hall"
        onClick={(e) => {
console.log("Marker clicked!", e.coord);
        }}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

## Step 7: Handle loading status

Display SDK loading status and handle errors:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider, useNaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapContainer() {
  const { sdkStatus, sdkError, reloadSdk } = useNaverMap();

  if (sdkStatus === "loading") {
return <div>Loading map...</div>;
  }

  if (sdkStatus === "error") {
    return (
      <div>
<p>Map loading failed: {sdkError?.message}</p>
<button onClick={reloadSdk}>Try again</button>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <NaverMap
      center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      zoom={12}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    />
  );
}

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <MapContainer />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Next steps

- [Core Concepts](/guide/core-concepts) - Understanding the operating principles of Provider, Map, and Hook
- [Submodule](/guide/submodules/geocoder) - How to use Geocoder, Panorama, Drawing, Visualization, GL modules
- [Marker examples](/examples/markers) - How to use various markers
- [API Reference](/api/provider) - Full API documentation

## Troubleshooting

Can't see the map? Please check [Frequently Asked Questions](/troubleshooting/common-issues).

---

## Source File: guide/core-concepts.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/core-concepts
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/core-concepts.md

# Core Concept

This page explains the core architecture and operation of `react-naver-maps-kit`.

## Architecture Overview

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    NaverMapProvider                      │
│  ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────┐    │
│  │              SDK Loading State                    │    │
│  │   idle → loading → ready                         │    │
│  │                  ↘ error                         │    │
│  └─────────────────────────────────────────────────┘    │
│                                                          │
│  ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────┐    │
│  │                  NaverMap                        │    │
│  │  ┌─────────┐ ┌─────────┐ ┌─────────┐            │    │
│  │  │ Marker  │ │ Circle  │ │ InfoWindow │ ...     │    │
│  │  └─────────┘ └─────────┘ └─────────┘            │    │
│  └─────────────────────────────────────────────────┘    │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Provider pattern

### Why do you need a Provider?

Naver Map SDK is an external JavaScript library. To use it in your React app:

1. **SDK script loading** - Dynamically inserting `<script>` tags
2. **Loading State Management** - Track when the SDK is ready
3. **Error handling** - Network error, authentication failure response
4. **Share Map Instance** - Access the same map from multiple components

`NaverMapProvider` manages all of this in one place.

### State Machine

SDK loading goes through the following states:

```
idle → loading → ready
             ↘ error
```

| status | Description |
| --------- | -------------------------------- |
| `idle` | Initial state (not started loading yet) |
| `loading` | Loading SDK script |
| `ready` | SDK ready, maps can be created |
| `error` | Loading failure or authentication error |

### Context value

Values ​​accessible with the `useNaverMap()` hook:

```tsx
interface NaverMapContextValue {
  sdkStatus: "idle" | "loading" | "ready" | "error";
  sdkError: Error | null;
  map: naver.maps.Map | null;
  reloadSdk: () => Promise<void>;
  retrySdk: () => Promise<void>;
  clearSdkError: () => void;
}
```

## Map life cycle

### NaverMap component operation

```tsx
// 1. When mounting
// - Wait for SDK to be ready (check Provider status)
// - Create naver.maps.Map instance
// - Register event listener
// - Register map instance with Provider

// 2. When updating
// - Detect only changed props
// - Update with map method calls (setCenter, setZoom, etc.)

// 3. When unmounting
// - Release event listener
// - call map.destroy()
// - Remove map instance from Provider
```

### Controlled vs Uncontrolled

Select control mode with `center`/`defaultCenter`, `zoom`/`defaultZoom`:

```tsx
// Controlled: Fully controlled by React state
const [center, setCenter] = useState({ lat: 37.5, lng: 127.0 });

<NaverMap
  center={center}
  onCenterChanged={setCenter}
/>

// Uncontrolled: Use map internal state
<NaverMap
  defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5, lng: 127.0 }}
  defaultZoom={12}
/>
```

| Prop | Action |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| `center` | Control with React state, move map when changed |
| `defaultCenter` | Set only the initial value, then the internal state of the map |
| `zoom` | Controlled by React state |
| `defaultZoom` | Set initial value only |

## Overlay system

### Overlay component structure

All overlay components follow the same pattern:

```tsx
interface OverlayProps {
// 1. Map options
  position?: Coord;
  visible?: boolean;
  zIndex?: number;
  // ...

// 2. Life cycle callback
  onOverlayReady?: (instance) => void;
  onOverlayDestroy?: () => void;

// 3. Event handler
  onClick?: (event) => void;
  // ...

// 4. React specialization
children?: React.ReactNode; // For custom rendering
}
```

### Overlay Context Integration

Overlays only work inside `NaverMap`:

```tsx
// ✅ Correct use
<NaverMap>
  <Marker position={...} />
</NaverMap>

// ❌ Incorrect use - Use directly outside the Provider
<Marker position={...} /> // Error: No map instance
```

### Automatic life cycle management

```tsx
// You don't need to write this code yourself
useEffect(() => {
  const marker = new naver.maps.Marker({ position, map });

// Register event listener
  const listener = naver.maps.Event.addListener(marker, "click", onClick);

  return () => {
// organize
    naver.maps.Event.removeListener(listener);
    marker.setMap(null);
  };
}, [position, onClick]);

// instead use this
<Marker position={position} onClick={onClick} />;
```

## How to use Hook

### useNaverMap

Access the entire Provider context:

```tsx
function MapController() {
  const { sdkStatus, map, reloadSdk } = useNaverMap();

// Check if SDK is ready
  if (sdkStatus !== "ready") return null;

// Utilize map instance
  const handlePanToSeoul = () => {
    map?.panTo(new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5665, 126.978));
  };

return <button onClick={handlePanToSeoul}>Go to Seoul</button>;
}
```

### useNaverMapInstance

When you only need a map instance:

```tsx
function MapInfo() {
  const map = useNaverMapInstance();

  const zoom = map?.getZoom();
  const center = map?.getCenter();

  return (
    <div>
zoom: {zoom}, center: {center?.toString()}
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Safety guard options

```tsx
// Throw an error if the SDK is not ready
const { map } = useNaverMap({ requireReady: true });

// Throws an error if there is no map instance
const map = useNaverMapInstance({ requireMapInstance: true });
```

## Imperative access with Ref

If the declarative API doesn't work, access the SDK instance directly with Ref:

```tsx
function AdvancedMap() {
  const mapRef = useRef<NaverMapRef>(null);
  const markerRef = useRef<MarkerRef>(null);

// call map method
  const fitToMarkers = () => {
    const bounds = new naver.maps.LatLngBounds();
    bounds.extend(markerRef.current?.getPosition());
    mapRef.current?.fitBounds(bounds);
  };

  return (
    <>
<button onClick={fitToMarkers}>Fit to markers</button>
      <NaverMap ref={mapRef} ...>
        <Marker ref={markerRef} position={...} />
      </NaverMap>
    </>
  );
}
```

## Best practices

### 1. Provider location

Place it at the top of your app:

```tsx
// ✅ Good: Top
function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={...}>
      <Router>
        <Routes />
      </Router>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}

// ⚠️ Caution: If you create a provider for each page, SDK reloading will occur.
```

### 2. Display loading status

Always handle loading/error conditions:

```tsx
function MapPage() {
  const { sdkStatus, sdkError, reloadSdk } = useNaverMap();

  switch (sdkStatus) {
    case "loading":
      return <LoadingSpinner />;
    case "error":
      return <ErrorDisplay error={sdkError} onRetry={reloadSdk} />;
    default:
      return <NaverMap ... />;
  }
}
```

### 3. Bulk marker processing

For hundreds or more markers, use `MarkerClusterer`:

```tsx
// ❌ Performance issues
{
  markers.map((m) => <Marker key={m.id} position={m.pos} />);
}

// ✅ Enable clustering
<MarkerClusterer>
  {markers.map((m) => (
    <Marker key={m.id} clustererItemId={m.id} position={m.pos} />
  ))}
</MarkerClusterer>;
```

### 4. Memoization

Avoid unnecessary re-rendering:

```tsx
// event handler memoization
const handleMarkerClick = useCallback((e) => {
  console.log(e.coord);
}, []);

// Coordinate object memoization
const center = useMemo(() => ({ lat: 37.5, lng: 127 }), []);

<Marker position={center} onClick={handleMarkerClick} />;
```

## Next steps

- [Marker examples](/examples/markers) - Learn with actual code
- [API Reference](/api/map) - Full list of Props

---

## Source File: guide/submodules/geocoder.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/submodules/geocoder
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/submodules/geocoder.md

# Geocoder submodule

The Geocoder submodule provides conversion methods between coordinate systems and an address lookup API.

## outline

The Geocoder module provides the following features:

- **Coordinate-Address Conversion**: Convert coordinates to address (Reverse Geocoding)
- **Address-coordinate conversion**: Convert address to coordinates (Geocoding)
- **Coordinate system conversion**: Conversion between various coordinate systems

## Load submodule

Load it through the `submodules` prop of `NaverMapProvider`:

```tsx
import { NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["geocoder"]}>
{/* App component */}
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Main API

### naver.maps.Service

This is the core namespace for the Geocoder service.

#### Geocoding (address → coordinates)

```tsx
naver.maps.Service.geocode(
  {
query: "Buljeong-ro 6" // Address to search
  },
  (status, response) => {
    if (status === naver.maps.Service.Status.OK) {
const result = response.v2; // search results
      console.log(result.addresses);
    }
  }
);
```

#### Reverse Geocoding (coordinates → address)

```tsx
naver.maps.Service.reverseGeocode(
  {
    coords: new naver.maps.LatLng(37.3595704, 127.105399),
    orders: [
naver.maps.Service.OrderType.ADDR, // Address
naver.maps.Service.OrderType.ROAD_ADDR // Road name address
    ].join(",")
  },
  (status, response) => {
    if (status === naver.maps.Service.Status.OK) {
const result = response.v2; // conversion result
      console.log(result.results);
    }
  }
);
```

### naver.maps.TransCoord

A coordinate system conversion utility.

```tsx
// TM128 → LatLng conversion
const latLng = naver.maps.TransCoord.fromTM128ToLatLng(new naver.maps.Point(311975, 544423));

// LatLng → TM128 conversion
const tm128 = naver.maps.TransCoord.fromLatLngToTM128(new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5666, 126.9784));
```

## Supported coordinate systems

| coordinate system | Description | Use |
| ------------ | ----------------- | -------------- |
| `LatLng` | WGS84 latitude/longitude | General map coordinates |
| `TM128` | TM128 coordinate system | Category Search |
| `UTMK` | UTM-K coordinate system | spatial information |
| `UTMK_NAVER` | Naver-only UTM-K | Inside Naver |

## Example of use

### Display marker after address search

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider, useNaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useState, useCallback } from "react";

function AddressSearch() {
  const { sdkStatus } = useNaverMap();
  const [marker, setMarker] = useState<{ lat: number; lng: number } | null>(null);

  const searchAddress = useCallback(
    (query: string) => {
      if (sdkStatus !== "ready") return;

      naver.maps.Service.geocode({ query }, (status, response) => {
        if (status === naver.maps.Service.Status.OK) {
          const address = response.v2.addresses[0];
          setMarker({
            lat: parseFloat(address.y),
            lng: parseFloat(address.x)
          });
        }
      });
    },
    [sdkStatus]
  );

  return (
    <div>
      <input
        type="text"
placeholder="Enter address"
        onKeyDown={(e) => {
          if (e.key === "Enter") {
            searchAddress((e.target as HTMLInputElement).value);
          }
        }}
      />
      {marker && (
        <NaverMap center={marker} zoom={15} style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}>
          <Marker position={marker} />
        </NaverMap>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Displays the address of the clicked location

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider, useNaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useState, useCallback } from "react";

function MapWithAddress() {
  const { sdkStatus } = useNaverMap();
  const [address, setAddress] = useState<string>("");

  const handleMapClick = useCallback(
    (e: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => {
      if (sdkStatus !== "ready") return;

      naver.maps.Service.reverseGeocode(
        {
          coords: e.coord,
          orders: naver.maps.Service.OrderType.ROAD_ADDR
        },
        (status, response) => {
          if (status === naver.maps.Service.Status.OK) {
            const result = response.v2.results[0];
            if (result) {
              setAddress(result.region.area1.name + " " + result.region.area2.name);
            }
          }
        }
      );
    },
    [sdkStatus]
  );

  return (
    <div>
<p>Address: {address}</p>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        onClick={handleMapClick}
      />
    </div>
  );
}
```

## status code

| status | Description |
| ------------------ | --------------- |
| `OK` | Request Successful |
| `ERROR` | server error |
| `INVALID_REQUEST` | Bad request |
| `OVER_QUERY_LIMIT` | Query limit exceeded |
| `REQUEST_DENIED` | Request denied |
| `UNKNOWN_ERROR` | unknown error |

## reference

- [Official Geocoder document](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-Geocoder.html)
- [Official Geocoding API Document](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-Geocoder-Geocoding.html)

---

## Source File: guide/submodules/panorama.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/submodules/panorama
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/submodules/panorama.md

# Panorama submodule

The Panorama submodule provides street view and aerial view.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="panorama" height="500px" />

## outline

The Panorama module provides the following features:

- **Street View**: Explore the streets with 360-degree panoramic images
- **Aerial view**: Panoramic image taken from the air
- **Map Link**: Location synchronization between map and panorama
- **Marker support**: Marker component can be used inside the panorama

## Load submodule

Load it through the `submodules` prop of `NaverMapProvider`:

```tsx
import { NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["panorama"]}>
{/* App component */}
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Component

### Panorama

This is a panorama viewer component.

```tsx
import { Panorama } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function PanoramaView() {
  return (
    <Panorama
      defaultPosition={{ lat: 37.3595704, lng: 127.105399 }}
      defaultPov={{ pan: 0, tilt: 0, fov: 100 }}
      flightSpot={true}
      aroundControl={true}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      onInit={() => console.log("Panorama initialized")}
      onPanoChanged={() => console.log("Panorama changed")}
      onPovChanged={() => console.log("POV changed")}
    />
  );
}
```

#### Type definition

```ts
interface PanoramaOptionProps {
  size?: naver.maps.Size | naver.maps.SizeLiteral;
  panoId?: string;
  position?: { lat: number; lng: number } | naver.maps.LatLng;
  defaultPosition?: { lat: number; lng: number } | naver.maps.LatLng;
  pov?: { pan?: number; tilt?: number; fov?: number };
  defaultPov?: { pan?: number; tilt?: number; fov?: number };
  visible?: boolean;
  minScale?: number;
  maxScale?: number;
  minZoom?: number;
  maxZoom?: number;
  flightSpot?: boolean;
  logoControl?: boolean;
  logoControlOptions?: naver.maps.LogoControlOptions;
  zoomControl?: boolean;
  zoomControlOptions?: naver.maps.ZoomControlOptions;
  aroundControl?: boolean;
  aroundControlOptions?: naver.maps.AroundControlOptions;
}

interface PanoramaLifecycleProps {
  children?: React.ReactNode;
  onPanoramaReady?: (panorama: naver.maps.Panorama) => void;
  onPanoramaDestroy?: () => void;
  onPanoramaError?: (error: Error) => void;
}

interface PanoramaEventProps {
  onInit?: () => void;
  onPanoChanged?: () => void;
  onPanoStatus?: (status: string) => void;
  onPovChanged?: () => void;
}

type PanoramaProps = PanoramaOptionProps &
  PanoramaLifecycleProps &
  PanoramaEventProps & {
    style?: React.CSSProperties;
    className?: string;
  };

interface PanoramaRef {
  getInstance: () => naver.maps.Panorama | null;
  getElement: () => HTMLElement | undefined;
  getLocation: () => naver.maps.PanoramaLocation | undefined;
  getMaxScale: () => number | undefined;
  getMaxZoom: () => number | undefined;
  getMinScale: () => number | undefined;
  getMinZoom: () => number | undefined;
  getOptions: (key?: string) => unknown;
  getPanoId: () => string | undefined;
  getPosition: () => naver.maps.LatLng | undefined;
  getPov: () => { pan?: number; tilt?: number; fov?: number } | undefined;
  getProjection: () => naver.maps.PanoramaProjection | undefined;
  getScale: () => number | undefined;
  getSize: () => naver.maps.Size | undefined;
  getVisible: () => boolean | undefined;
  getZoom: () => number | undefined;
  setOptions: (options: naver.maps.PanoramaOptions) => void;
  setPanoId: (panoId: string) => void;
  setPanoIdWithPov: (panoId: string, pov: { pan?: number; tilt?: number; fov?: number }) => void;
  setPosition: (position: naver.maps.LatLng) => void;
  setPov: (pov: { pan?: number; tilt?: number; fov?: number }) => void;
  setScale: (scale: number) => void;
  setSize: (size: naver.maps.Size) => void;
  setVisible: (visible: boolean) => void;
  setZoom: (zoom: number) => void;
  zoomIn: () => void;
  zoomOut: () => void;
}
```

#### Props

| Prop | Type | Description |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------- | --------------------------------- |
| `position` | `{ lat: number; lng: number }` | Panoramic location (controlled) |
| `defaultPosition` | `{ lat: number; lng: number }` | Initial panoramic position (uncontrolled) |
| `panoId` | `string` | Panorama ID |
| `pov` | `{ pan, tilt, fov }` | viewpoint (controlled) |
| `defaultPov` | `{ pan, tilt, fov }` | Early point in time (uncontrolled) |
| `visible` | `boolean` | Visibility |
| `size` | `naver.maps.Size` | Panoramic size |
| `minScale` | `number` | Minimum scale |
| `maxScale` | `number` | maximum scale |
| `minZoom` | `number` | Minimum zoom level |
| `maxZoom` | `number` | maximum zoom level |
| `flightSpot` | `boolean` | Show aerial view switching button |
| `aroundControl` | `boolean` | Show Nearby View Controls |
| `aroundControlOptions` | `naver.maps.AroundControlOptions` | Nearby view control options |
| `zoomControl` | `boolean` | Show zoom controls |
| `zoomControlOptions` | `naver.maps.ZoomControlOptions` | Zoom control options |
| `logoControl` | `boolean` | Show logo control |
| `logoControlOptions` | `naver.maps.LogoControlOptions` | Logo Control Options |
| `style` | `CSSProperties` | container style |
| `className` | `string` | Container class name |
| `children` | `ReactNode` | Child components such as internal markers |
| `onPanoramaReady` | `(panorama) => void` | Instance creation completion callback |
| `onPanoramaDestroy` | `() => void` | Instance cleanup complete callback |
| `onPanoramaError` | `(error: Error) => void` | creation failure callback |
| `onInit` | `() => void` | Initialization complete event |
| `onPanoChanged` | `() => void` | Panorama change event |
| `onPovChanged` | `() => void` | View point change event |
| `onPanoStatus` | `(status: string) => void` | Panorama state change event |

#### Controlled vs Uncontrolled

`position` and `pov` support controlled/uncontrolled patterns:

```tsx
// Uncontrolled: Set only initial values, then manage as internal state
<Panorama
  defaultPosition={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
  defaultPov={{ pan: 0, tilt: 0, fov: 100 }}
/>;

// Controlled: synchronized with React state
const [position, setPosition] = useState({ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 });
const [pov, setPov] = useState({ pan: 0, tilt: 0, fov: 100 });

<Panorama
  position={position}
  pov={pov}
  onPovChanged={() => {
// update pov status
  }}
/>;
```

#### Ref Methods

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { Panorama, type PanoramaRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function PanoramaWithRef() {
  const panoramaRef = useRef<PanoramaRef>(null);

  return (
    <>
      <Panorama ref={panoramaRef} defaultPosition={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} />
      <button
        onClick={() => {
          const pos = panoramaRef.current?.getPosition();
          console.log(pos?.lat(), pos?.lng());
        }}
      >
        Get Position
      </button>
    </>
  );
}
```

| method | return type | Description |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `naver.maps.Panorama` | Panorama instance |
| `getElement()` | `HTMLElement` | container DOM element |
| `getLocation()` | `naver.maps.PanoramaLocation` | Current location information |
| `getPosition()` | `naver.maps.LatLng` | Current location |
| `setPosition()` | `void` | Location Settings |
| `getPov()` | `{ pan, tilt, fov }` | Current moment |
| `setPov()` | `void` | View point settings |
| `getPanoId()` | `string` | Current panorama ID |
| `setPanoId()` | `void` | Panorama ID settings |
| `setPanoIdWithPov()` | `void` | Simultaneous setting of ID and time point |
| `getZoom()` | `number` | Current zoom level |
| `setZoom()` | `void` | Zoom level settings |
| `zoomIn()` | `void` | Zoom in |
| `zoomOut()` | `void` | Zoom out |
| `getScale()` | `number` | Current scale |
| `setScale()` | `void` | scale settings |
| `getMinScale()` | `number` | Minimum scale |
| `getMaxScale()` | `number` | maximum scale |
| `getMinZoom()` | `number` | Minimum zoom level |
| `getMaxZoom()` | `number` | maximum zoom level |
| `getSize()` | `naver.maps.Size` | Panoramic size |
| `setSize()` | `void` | Size Settings |
| `getVisible()` | `boolean` | Visibility |
| `setVisible()` | `void` | Visibility settings |
| `getOptions()` | `unknown` | Option inquiry |
| `setOptions()` | `void` | Option Settings |
| `getProjection()` | `naver.maps.PanoramaProjection` | projection object |

### FlightSpot

This is a component that displays the aerial view location on the map.

```tsx
import { NaverMap, FlightSpot } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithFlightSpot() {
  return (
    <NaverMap defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} defaultZoom={15}>
      <FlightSpot
        onPoiClicked={(panoId) => {
          console.log("FlightSpot clicked:", panoId);
        }}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

### Panorama interior marker

You can use `Marker` inside the `Panorama` component:

```tsx
import { Panorama, Marker } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function PanoramaWithMarkers() {
  return (
    <Panorama defaultPosition={{ lat: 37.3595704, lng: 127.105399 }}>
      <Marker position={{ lat: 37.3595704, lng: 127.105399 }}>
        <div
          style={{
            background: "#FF5722",
            color: "white",
            padding: "4px 10px",
            borderRadius: 16
          }}
        >
Naver headquarters
        </div>
      </Marker>
    </Panorama>
  );
}
```

## Example of use

### Linking maps and panoramas (Controlled)

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, Panorama, FlightSpot } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithPanorama() {
  const [position, setPosition] = useState({ lat: 37.3595704, lng: 127.105399 });
  const [pov, setPov] = useState({ pan: 0, tilt: 0, fov: 100 });

  return (
    <div style={{ display: "flex", gap: "16px" }}>
      <NaverMap center={position} zoom={15} style={{ width: "50%", height: "400px" }}>
        <Marker
          position={position}
          draggable={true}
          onDragEnd={(e) => {
            setPosition({ lat: e.coord.y, lng: e.coord.x });
          }}
        />
        <FlightSpot />
      </NaverMap>
      <Panorama
        position={position}
        pov={pov}
        onPovChanged={() => {
// Logic required when changing POV
        }}
        style={{ width: "50%", height: "400px" }}
      />
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Enter aerial view with FlightSpot

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, FlightSpot, Panorama } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithFlightSpot() {
  const [showPanorama, setShowPanorama] = useState(false);
  const [panoId, setPanoId] = useState<string | null>(null);

  return (
    <div style={{ display: "flex", gap: "16px" }}>
      <NaverMap
        defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        defaultZoom={15}
        style={{ width: "50%", height: "400px" }}
      >
        <FlightSpot
          onPoiClicked={(id) => {
            setPanoId(id);
            setShowPanorama(true);
          }}
        />
      </NaverMap>

      {showPanorama && panoId && (
        <Panorama panoId={panoId} style={{ width: "50%", height: "400px" }} />
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```

### POV (Point of View) Control

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { Panorama } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function PanoramaControls() {
  const [pov, setPov] = useState({ pan: 0, tilt: 0, fov: 100 });

  const rotateLeft = () => {
    setPov((prev) => ({ ...prev, pan: prev.pan - 45 }));
  };

  const rotateRight = () => {
    setPov((prev) => ({ ...prev, pan: prev.pan + 45 }));
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <Panorama
        defaultPosition={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        pov={pov}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
      />
      <div style={{ marginTop: 8 }}>
<button onClick={rotateLeft}>← Rotate Left</button>
<button onClick={rotateRight}>Rotate right →</button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## event

| Event | Description |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| `init` | Initialization complete |
| `pano_changed` | Change panorama ID |
| `pov_changed` | Change viewpoint |
| `pano_status` | Change panorama state |

## reference

- [Official Panorama document](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-Panorama.html)
- [Official Panorama API](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/naver.maps.Panorama.html)

---

## Source File: guide/submodules/visualization.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/submodules/visualization
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/submodules/visualization.md

# Visualization submodule

The Visualization submodule provides tools for visualizing geographic data.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="visualization" height="550px" />

## outline

The Visualization module provides the following features:

- **HeatMap**: Density expressed in color
- **DotMap**: Expresses individual locations as dots
- **Weighted data**: Weighted by location

## Load submodule

Load it through the `submodules` prop of `NaverMapProvider`:

```tsx
import { NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["visualization"]}>
{/* App component */}
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Component

### HeatMap

This is a component that displays a heat map.

```tsx
import { NaverMap, HeatMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithHeatMap() {
  const data = [
    { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978, weight: 10 },
    { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979, weight: 5 },
    { lat: 37.5667, lng: 126.98, weight: 8 }
  ];

  return (
    <NaverMap
      defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      defaultZoom={14}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <HeatMap
        data={data}
        radius={20}
        opacity={0.6}
        colorMap={naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle.RAINBOW}
        colorMapReverse={false}
        onHeatMapReady={(heatMap) => console.log("HeatMap ready", heatMap)}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

#### Type definition

```ts
interface HeatMapOptionProps {
  data:
    | naver.maps.LatLng[]
    | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[]
    | naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation[]
    | Array<{ lat: number; lng: number; weight?: number }>;
  opacity?: number;
  radius?: number;
  colorMap?: naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle;
  colorMapReverse?: boolean;
}

interface HeatMapProps extends HeatMapOptionProps {
  onHeatMapReady?: (heatMap: naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap) => void;
}

interface HeatMapRef {
  getInstance: () => naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap | null;
  getMap: () => naver.maps.Map | null;
  setData: (
    data:
      | naver.maps.LatLng[]
      | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[]
      | naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation[]
  ) => void;
  addData: (
    data:
      | naver.maps.LatLng
      | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral
      | naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation
  ) => void;
  redraw: () => void;
}
```

#### Props

| Prop | Type | default | Description |
| ----------------- | -------------------------------- | ------- | ----------------------- |
| `data` | `LatLng[] \| WeightedLocation[]` | - | visualization data |
| `radius` | `number` | `20` | radius (pixels) |
| `opacity` | `number` | `0.6` | Opacity (0-1) |
| `colorMap` | `SpectrumStyle` | - | color spectrum |
| `colorMapReverse` | `boolean` | `false` | Spectral Color Inversion |
| `onHeatMapReady` | `(heatMap) => void` | - | Instance creation completion callback |

#### Supported data formats

HeatMap supports data in various formats:

```tsx
// 1. Array of objects (with weight) - most convenient format
const data1 = [
  { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978, weight: 10 },
  { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979, weight: 5 }
];

// 2. Object array (no weight)
const data2 = [
  { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 },
  { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979 }
];

// 3. naver.maps.LatLng array
const data3 = [new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5665, 126.978), new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5666, 126.979)];

// 4. PointArrayLiteral array
const data4 = [
  [37.5665, 126.978],
  [37.5666, 126.979]
];

// 5. WeightedLocation array
const data5 = [
  new naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation(37.5665, 126.978, 10),
  new naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation(37.5666, 126.979, 5)
];
```

#### Color Spectrum (SpectrumStyle)

Available Spectrum Styles:

| spectrum | Description |
| ---------- | ----------------------- |
| `RAINBOW` | rainbow colors |
| `JET` | Jet color |
| `HSV` | HSV color space |
| `HOT` | Hot colors (black → red) |
| `COOL` | Cool colors (cyan→magenta) |
| `GREYS` | gray series |
| `YIGnBu` | Yellow→Green→Blue |
| `YIOrRd` | Yellow→Orange→Red |
| `RdBu` | red → blue |
| `PORTLAND` | Portland Colors |
| `OXYGEN` | Oxygen Colors |

```tsx
<HeatMap data={data} colorMap={naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle.JET} colorMapReverse={true} />
```

#### Ref Methods

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { NaverMap, HeatMap, type HeatMapRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function HeatMapWithRef() {
  const heatMapRef = useRef<HeatMapRef>(null);

  const addPoint = () => {
    heatMapRef.current?.addData(
      new naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation(37.5665, 126.978, 10)
    );
  };

  return (
    <>
      <NaverMap defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} defaultZoom={14}>
        <HeatMap ref={heatMapRef} data={[]} />
      </NaverMap>
<button onClick={addPoint}>Add Point</button>
    </>
  );
}
```

| method | return type | Description |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------- | ---------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap` | HeatMap instance |
| `getMap()` | `naver.maps.Map` | map instance |
| `setData()` | `void` | data settings |
| `addData()` | `void` | Add data |
| `redraw()` | `void` | Redraw |

---

### DotMap

This is a component that displays a dot map.

```tsx
import { NaverMap, DotMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithDotMap() {
  const data = [
    { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 },
    { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979 },
    { lat: 37.5667, lng: 126.98 }
  ];

  return (
    <NaverMap
      defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      defaultZoom={14}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <DotMap
        data={data}
        radius={5}
        opacity={0.8}
        fillColor="#03C75A"
        strokeColor="#ffffff"
        strokeWeight={1}
        onDotMapReady={(dotMap) => console.log("DotMap ready", dotMap)}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

#### Type definition

```ts
interface DotMapOptionProps {
  data: naver.maps.LatLng[] | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[] | Array<{ lat: number; lng: number }>;
  opacity?: number;
  radius?: number;
  strokeWeight?: number;
  strokeColor?: string;
  strokeLineCap?: "butt" | "round" | "square";
  strokeLineJoin?: "bevel" | "miter" | "round";
  fillColor?: string;
}

interface DotMapProps extends DotMapOptionProps {
  onDotMapReady?: (dotMap: naver.maps.visualization.DotMap) => void;
}

interface DotMapRef {
  getInstance: () => naver.maps.visualization.DotMap | null;
  getMap: () => naver.maps.Map | null;
  setData: (data: naver.maps.LatLng[] | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[]) => void;
  addData: (data: naver.maps.LatLng | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral) => void;
  redraw: () => void;
}
```

#### Props

| Prop | Type | default | Description |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------- | ----------- | ----------------------- |
| `data` | `LatLng[] \| object[]` | - | visualization data |
| `radius` | `number` | `5` | point radius (pixels) |
| `opacity` | `number` | `0.6` | Opacity (0-1) |
| `fillColor` | `string` | `"#ff0000"` | fill color |
| `strokeColor` | `string` | `"#fff"` | border color |
| `strokeWeight` | `number` | `1` | border thickness |
| `strokeLineCap` | `"butt" \| "round" \| "square"` | `"round"` | Line End Style |
| `strokeLineJoin` | `"bevel" \| "miter" \| "round"` | `"round"` | Line connection style |
| `onDotMapReady` | `(dotMap) => void` | - | Instance creation completion callback |

#### Ref Methods

| method | return type | Description |
| --------------- | --------------------------------- | --------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `naver.maps.visualization.DotMap` | DotMap instance |
| `getMap()` | `naver.maps.Map` | map instance |
| `setData()` | `void` | data settings |
| `addData()` | `void` | Add data |
| `redraw()` | `void` | Redraw |

---

## Example of use

### Basic heatmap

```tsx
import { NaverMap, HeatMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useMemo } from "react";

function generateRandomPoints(count: number) {
  const points = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    points.push({
      lat: 37.5 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      lng: 126.9 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      weight: Math.floor(Math.random() * 10) + 1
    });
  }
  return points;
}

function BasicHeatMap() {
  const data = useMemo(() => generateRandomPoints(200), []);

  return (
    <NaverMap
      defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 126.95 }}
      defaultZoom={13}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <HeatMap data={data} radius={25} opacity={0.7} />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

### Basic point map

```tsx
import { NaverMap, DotMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useMemo } from "react";

function generateRandomPoints(count: number) {
  const points = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    points.push({
      lat: 37.5 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      lng: 126.9 + Math.random() * 0.1
    });
  }
  return points;
}

function BasicDotMap() {
  const data = useMemo(() => generateRandomPoints(100), []);

  return (
    <NaverMap
      defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 126.95 }}
      defaultZoom={13}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <DotMap
        data={data}
        radius={6}
        opacity={0.8}
        fillColor="#03C75A"
        strokeColor="#ffffff"
        strokeWeight={1}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

### Data dynamic update

```tsx
import { useState, useMemo } from "react";
import { NaverMap, HeatMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function generateRandomPoints(count: number) {
  const points = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    points.push({
      lat: 37.5 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      lng: 126.9 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      weight: Math.floor(Math.random() * 10) + 1
    });
  }
  return points;
}

function DynamicHeatMap() {
  const [pointCount, setPointCount] = useState(100);
  const [radius, setRadius] = useState(20);
  const [opacity, setOpacity] = useState(0.6);

  const data = useMemo(() => generateRandomPoints(pointCount), [pointCount]);

  return (
    <div>
      <div style={{ marginBottom: 16, display: "flex", gap: 16 }}>
        <label>
Number of points: {pointCount}
          <input
            type="range"
            min={50}
            max={500}
            value={pointCount}
            onChange={(e) => setPointCount(Number(e.target.value))}
          />
        </label>
        <label>
Radius: {radius}px
          <input
            type="range"
            min={5}
            max={50}
            value={radius}
            onChange={(e) => setRadius(Number(e.target.value))}
          />
        </label>
        <label>
Opacity: {opacity.toFixed(1)}
          <input
            type="range"
            min={0}
            max={100}
            value={opacity * 100}
            onChange={(e) => setOpacity(Number(e.target.value) / 100)}
          />
        </label>
      </div>

      <NaverMap
        defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 126.95 }}
        defaultZoom={13}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <HeatMap data={data} radius={radius} opacity={opacity} />
      </NaverMap>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Spectrum changes

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, HeatMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

const spectrumOptions = [
  "RAINBOW",
  "JET",
  "HSV",
  "HOT",
  "COOL",
  "GREYS",
  "YIGnBu",
  "YIOrRd",
  "RdBu",
  "PORTLAND",
  "OXYGEN"
];

function HeatMapWithSpectrum() {
  const [spectrum, setSpectrum] = useState("RAINBOW");
  const [reverse, setReverse] = useState(false);

  const data = [
    { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978, weight: 10 },
    { lat: 37.567, lng: 126.98, weight: 8 },
    { lat: 37.566, lng: 126.975, weight: 6 }
  ];

  const colorMap =
    naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle[
      spectrum as keyof typeof naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle
    ];

  return (
    <div>
      <div style={{ marginBottom: 16, display: "flex", gap: 16 }}>
        <select value={spectrum} onChange={(e) => setSpectrum(e.target.value)}>
          {spectrumOptions.map((opt) => (
            <option key={opt} value={opt}>
              {opt}
            </option>
          ))}
        </select>
        <label>
          <input type="checkbox" checked={reverse} onChange={(e) => setReverse(e.target.checked)} />
spectrum inversion
        </label>
      </div>

      <NaverMap
        defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        defaultZoom={15}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <HeatMap
          data={data}
          radius={30}
          opacity={0.7}
          colorMap={colorMap}
          colorMapReverse={reverse}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Switch between HeatMap and DotMap

```tsx
import { useState, useMemo } from "react";
import { NaverMap, HeatMap, DotMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function generateRandomPoints(count: number) {
  const points = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    points.push({
      lat: 37.5 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      lng: 126.9 + Math.random() * 0.1,
      weight: Math.floor(Math.random() * 10) + 1
    });
  }
  return points;
}

function VisualizationToggle() {
  const [type, setType] = useState<"heatmap" | "dotmap">("heatmap");
  const data = useMemo(() => generateRandomPoints(150), []);

  return (
    <div>
      <div style={{ marginBottom: 16 }}>
        <button
          onClick={() => setType("heatmap")}
          style={{ fontWeight: type === "heatmap" ? "bold" : "normal" }}
        >
          HeatMap
        </button>
        <button
          onClick={() => setType("dotmap")}
          style={{ fontWeight: type === "dotmap" ? "bold" : "normal" }}
        >
          DotMap
        </button>
      </div>

      <NaverMap
        defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 126.95 }}
        defaultZoom={13}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        {type === "heatmap" && <HeatMap data={data} radius={20} opacity={0.6} />}
        {type === "dotmap" && (
          <DotMap data={data} radius={5} fillColor="#EA4335" strokeColor="#fff" />
        )}
      </NaverMap>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Behavior Rules

1. **Instance creation**: Can only be used inside `NaverMap`.
2. **Map instance resolution**: Automatically uses the instance of the parent `NaverMap` through `MapInstanceContext`.
3. **Initialization Timing**: HeatMap/DotMap is created after the map is fully initialized (`map.isReady === true`).
4. **Reflection of Props changes**: When props such as `data`, `radius`, and `opacity` are changed, `setData()`, `setOptions()`, and `redraw()` are automatically called.
5. **Data Normalization**: Object arrays of the form `{ lat, lng, weight }` are automatically converted to `WeightedLocation`.
6. **Cleanup**: When unmounting a component, it is cleaned up with `setMap(null)`.

## reference

- [Official Visualization Document](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-Visualization.html)
- [Official HeatMap API](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap.html)
- [Official DotMap API](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/naver.maps.visualization.DotMap.html)
- [Official WeightedLocation API](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation.html)
- [Official SpectrumStyle API](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle.html)

---

## Source File: guide/submodules/drawing.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/submodules/drawing
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/submodules/drawing.md

# Drawing submodule

The Drawing submodule provides a graphical interface that allows the user to draw rectangles, ellipses, polylines, polylines with arrows, polygons, and markers on the map.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="drawing" height="550px" />

## Installation and setup

To use the Drawing submodule, you must set the `submodules` prop in `NaverMapProvider`.

```tsx
import { NaverMapProvider, NaverMap, DrawingManager } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId="YOUR_NCP_KEY_ID" submodules={["drawing"]}>
      <NaverMap>
        <DrawingManager />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## DrawingManager

The `DrawingManager` component provides a drawing tool UI to the map and allows users to draw and edit shapes.

### Basic usage

```tsx
import { NaverMap, DrawingManager } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MyMap() {
  return (
    <NaverMap defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.9784 }} defaultZoom={14}>
      <DrawingManager
        drawingControl={[
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.RECTANGLE,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ELLIPSE,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYLINE,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYGON,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.MARKER
        ]}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

### Props

#### Option Props

| Prop | Type | default | Description |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------- | --------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| `drawingControl` | `DrawingMode[] \| null` | All Tools | List of drawing tools to display. If `null`, hide tool UI |
| `drawingControlOptions` | `DrawingControlOptions` | - | Position and style of drawing tool controls |
| `drawingMode` | `DrawingMode` | `HAND` | Initial drawing mode |
| `controlPointOptions` | `DrawingControlPointOptions` | - | Edit Control Point Options |
| `rectangleOptions` | `RectangleOptions` | - | Rectangle Shape Options |
| `ellipseOptions` | `EllipseOptions` | - | Ellipse shape options |
| `polylineOptions` | `PolylineOptions` | - | Polyline Geometry Options |
| `arrowlineOptions` | `PolylineOptions` | - | Arrow Polyline Options |
| `polygonOptions` | `PolygonOptions` | - | polygon shape options |
| `markerOptions` | `MarkerOptions` | - | marker options |

#### Event Props

| Prop | Type | Description |
| ----------------------- | ----------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| `onDrawingAdded` | `(overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void` | When a shape is added |
| `onDrawingRemoved` | `(overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void` | When a shape is deleted |
| `onDrawingSelect` | `(overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void` | When a shape is selected |
| `onDrawingStart` | `(overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void` | When drawing begins |
| `onDrawingCanceled` | `(overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void` | When drawing is canceled |
| `onDrawingManagerReady` | `(manager: DrawingManager) => void` | When manager initialization is complete |

### DrawingMode

Available drawing modes.

```tsx
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.HAND; //default mode (drawing disabled)
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.RECTANGLE; // square
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ELLIPSE; // Ellipse
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYLINE; // polyline
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ARROWLINE; // arrow polyline
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYGON; // polygon
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.MARKER; // marker
```

### DrawingControlOptions

Sets the position and style of drawing tool controls.

```tsx
interface DrawingControlOptions {
position?: naver.maps.Position; // control position
style?: naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle; // control style
}
```

#### Location Options

```tsx
naver.maps.Position.TOP_LEFT;
naver.maps.Position.TOP_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.TOP_RIGHT;
naver.maps.Position.LEFT_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.RIGHT_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_LEFT;
naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_RIGHT;
```

#### Style Options

```tsx
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.HORIZONTAL; //horizontal array
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.HORIZONTAL_2; // horizontal arrangement (style 2)
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.VERTICAL; // vertical array
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.VERTICAL_2; // vertical array (style 2)
```

### Customizing shape style

You can set the style of each shape individually.

```tsx
<DrawingManager
  rectangleOptions={{
    fillColor: "#ff0000",
    fillOpacity: 0.3,
    strokeWeight: 2,
    strokeColor: "#ff0000"
  }}
  ellipseOptions={{
    fillColor: "#00ff00",
    fillOpacity: 0.3,
    strokeWeight: 2,
    strokeColor: "#00ff00"
  }}
  polylineOptions={{
    strokeColor: "#0000ff",
    strokeWeight: 3
  }}
  arrowlineOptions={{
    strokeColor: "#ff00ff",
    strokeWeight: 3
  }}
  polygonOptions={{
    fillColor: "#ffff00",
    fillOpacity: 0.3,
    strokeWeight: 2,
    strokeColor: "#ffd100"
  }}
/>
```

### Customizing edit control points

You can set the style of control points displayed when editing a shape.

```tsx
<DrawingManager
  controlPointOptions={{
    anchorPointOptions: {
      radius: 10,
      fillColor: "#ff0000",
      strokeColor: "#0000ff",
      strokeWeight: 2
    },
    midPointOptions: {
      radius: 8,
      fillColor: "#00ff00",
      strokeColor: "#0000ff",
      strokeWeight: 2,
      fillOpacity: 0.5
    }
  }}
/>
```

### Ref method

You can control it programmatically through `DrawingManagerRef`.

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { DrawingManager, type DrawingManagerRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MyMap() {
  const drawingRef = useRef<DrawingManagerRef>(null);

  const handleExport = () => {
    const geoJson = drawingRef.current?.toGeoJson();
    console.log(geoJson);
  };

  return (
    <>
      <DrawingManager ref={drawingRef} />
<button onClick={handleExport}>Export GeoJSON</button>
    </>
  );
}
```

#### Available methods

| method | return type | Description |
| -------------------------------- | -------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `DrawingManager\| null` | native DrawingManager instance |
| `getMap()` | `Map\| null` | associated Map instance |
| `getDrawings()` | `Record<string, DrawingOverlay>` | All drawn geometric objects |
| `getDrawing(id)` | `DrawingOverlay\| undefined` | Shape object with specific ID |
| `addDrawing(overlay, mode, id?)` | `void` | Add shape |
| `removeDrawing(overlayOrId)` | `void` | Delete shape |
| `toGeoJson()` | `object` | Export to GeoJSON format |
| `setDrawingMode(mode)` | `void` | Change drawing mode |
| `getDrawingMode()` | `DrawingMode\| undefined` | Current drawing mode |

### Full example

```tsx
import { useRef, useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, DrawingManager, type DrawingManagerRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function DrawingDemo() {
  const drawingRef = useRef<DrawingManagerRef>(null);
  const [drawings, setDrawings] = useState<string[]>([]);

  const updateDrawingsList = () => {
    const manager = drawingRef.current;
    if (!manager) return;
    const drawingsObj = manager.getDrawings();
    setDrawings(Object.keys(drawingsObj));
  };

  const handleExportGeoJson = () => {
    const json = drawingRef.current?.toGeoJson();
    console.log(JSON.stringify(json, null, 2));
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <div>
<p>Drawings: {drawings.length}</p>
<button onClick={handleExportGeoJson}>Export GeoJSON</button>
      </div>

      <NaverMap
        defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.9784 }}
        defaultZoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: 500 }}
      >
        <DrawingManager
          ref={drawingRef}
          drawingControl={[
            naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.RECTANGLE,
            naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ELLIPSE,
            naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYLINE,
            naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ARROWLINE,
            naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYGON,
            naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.MARKER
          ]}
          drawingControlOptions={{
            position: naver.maps.Position.TOP_CENTER,
            style: naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.HORIZONTAL
          }}
          rectangleOptions={{
            fillColor: "#ff0000",
            fillOpacity: 0.3,
            strokeWeight: 2,
            strokeColor: "#ff0000"
          }}
          onDrawingAdded={(overlay) => {
console.log("Added:", overlay);
            updateDrawingsList();
          }}
          onDrawingRemoved={() => {
            updateDrawingsList();
          }}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Behavior Rules

- **Left mouse click**: Select and edit drawn shapes
- **Right mouse click**: Delete drawn shape
- **HAND MODE**: Disable drawing, only basic map operations are possible.
- **Draw a shape**: Select the mode and click/drag on the map.
- **Polyline/Polygon**: Add points by clicking, complete by double clicking

## reference

- Circle is replaced by Ellipse.
- If you do not define `startIcon` or `endIcon` in `arrowlineOptions`, `endIcon` is displayed by default.
- The `startIcon` and `endIcon` options in `polylineOptions` are ignored.

---

## Source File: guide/submodules/gl.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/guide/submodules/gl
- Local Path: packages/docs/guide/submodules/gl.md

# GL submodule

The GL submodule provides high-performance vector maps based on WebGL.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="gl" height="550px" />

## outline

The GL module provides the following features:

- **Vector Map**: Smooth map rendering based on WebGL
- **Style Editor integration**: Apply custom style with Naver Style Editor
- **High resolution support**: Retina display compatible

## Load submodule

Load it through the `submodules` prop of `NaverMapProvider`:

```tsx
import { NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["gl"]}>
{/* App component */}
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Enable GL Map

Set the `gl` prop to `true` in the `NaverMap` component:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["gl"]}>
      <NaverMap
        gl={true}
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Style Editor integration

You can apply custom styles created in Naver [Style Editor](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-2-Style-Editor.html).

### Apply Style ID

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithCustomStyle() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["gl"]}>
      <NaverMap
        gl={true}
        customStyleId="STYLE_ID_FROM_STYLE_EDITOR"
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### How to issue a style ID

1. Access [Naver Cloud Platform Console](https://www.ncloud.com/)
2. Go to **Maps** → **Style Editor** menu
3. After creating a new style, click the **Publish** button
4. Copy issued style ID

## Example of use

### GL Map Basics

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function GlMap() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["gl"]}>
      <NaverMap
        gl={true}
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={15}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Dark theme style

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function DarkThemeMap() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["gl"]}>
      <NaverMap
        gl={true}
        customStyleId="YOUR_DARK_THEME_STYLE_ID"
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Layer Combination

GL maps allow you to combine different layers:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider, useNaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useEffect } from "react";

function GlMapWithLayers() {
  const { sdkStatus, map } = useNaverMap();

  useEffect(() => {
    if (sdkStatus !== "ready" || !map) return;

// Add real-time traffic layer
    const trafficLayer = new naver.maps.TrafficLayer({
      map: map
    });

    return () => {
      trafficLayer.setMap(null);
    };
  }, [sdkStatus, map]);

  return (
    <NaverMap
      gl={true}
      center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      zoom={12}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    />
  );
}
```

### Style switching by zoom level

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider, useNaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";

function AdaptiveStyleMap() {
  const { sdkStatus, map } = useNaverMap();
  const [currentZoom, setCurrentZoom] = useState(12);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (sdkStatus !== "ready" || !map) return;

    const listener = naver.maps.Event.addListener(map, "zoom_changed", (zoom) => {
      setCurrentZoom(zoom);
    });

    return () => {
      naver.maps.Event.removeListener(listener);
    };
  }, [sdkStatus, map]);

  const getStyleId = (zoom: number): string => {
    if (zoom < 10) return "STYLE_ID_FOR_LOW_ZOOM";
    if (zoom < 15) return "STYLE_ID_FOR_MEDIUM_ZOOM";
    return "STYLE_ID_FOR_HIGH_ZOOM";
  };

  return (
    <div>
<p>Current zoom level: {currentZoom}</p>
      <NaverMap
        gl={true}
        customStyleId={getStyleId(currentZoom)}
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={currentZoom}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </div>
  );
}
```

## GL vs normal map comparison

| Characteristics | General map | GL map |
| ------------------- | ------------- | ------------------------ |
| Rendering | Canvas | WebGL |
| Zoom animation | Tile Replacement | Smooth vector zoom |
| Style Customization | LIMITED | Full control with Style Editor |
| Performance | General | High Performance (Large Data) |
| Support environment | All browsers | WebGL supported browsers |

## caution

### Check WebGL support

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider, useNaverMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";

function SafeGlMap() {
  const [webglSupported, setWebglSupported] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() => {
    const canvas = document.createElement("canvas");
    const gl = canvas.getContext("webgl") || canvas.getContext("experimental-webgl");
    setWebglSupported(!!gl);
  }, []);

  if (!webglSupported) {
return <div>This browser does not support WebGL</div>;
  }

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={["gl"]}>
      <NaverMap
        gl={true}
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### GL map fallback

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";

function MapWithFallback() {
  const [useGl, setUseGl] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() => {
    const canvas = document.createElement("canvas");
    const gl = canvas.getContext("webgl");
    if (!gl) {
      console.warn("WebGL not supported, falling back to regular map");
      setUseGl(false);
    }
  }, []);

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID} submodules={useGl ? ["gl"] : []}>
      <NaverMap
        gl={useGl}
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## reference

- [Official GL document](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-1-GL.html)
- [Official Style Editor integration guide](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-2-Style-Editor.html)
- [Introducing new map tiles](https://navermaps.github.io/maps.js.ncp/docs/tutorial-StyleMap-1.html)

---

## Source File: api/provider.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/provider
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/provider.md

# NaverMapProvider

This is the root component that provides SDK loading status as React Context.

## Type definition

```ts
export type NaverMapSdkStatus = "idle" | "loading" | "ready" | "error";

export type Submodule = "geocoder" | "panorama" | "drawing" | "visualization" | "gl";

export interface NaverMapContextValue {
  sdkStatus: NaverMapSdkStatus;
  sdkError: Error | null;
  reloadSdk: () => Promise<void>;
  retrySdk: () => Promise<void>;
  clearSdkError: () => void;
  submodules: Submodule[];
  /** @deprecated Use useMapInstance() hook instead. Will be removed in future version. */
  map: naver.maps.Map | null;
  /** @deprecated Use MapInstanceContext instead. Will be removed in future version. */
  setMap: (map: naver.maps.Map | null) => void;
}

export interface NaverMapProviderProps extends LoadNaverMapsScriptOptions {
  children: React.ReactNode;
  autoLoad?: boolean;
  onReady?: () => void;
  onError?: (error: Error) => void;
}
```

## Props details

- `children: React.ReactNode`
- React node to render in the Provider subtree.
- `autoLoad?: boolean`
- Default `true`.
- If `true`, SDK loading starts automatically when mounted.
- `onReady?: () => void`
- Called after SDK loading is complete.
- `onError?: (error: Error) => void`
- Called when SDK loading fails or authentication fails.
- `submodules?: Submodule[]`
- List of submodules to load.
- Select from `"geocoder"`, `"panorama"`, `"drawing"`, `"visualization"`, and `"gl"`.
- `"gl"` cannot be used with other submodules.
- `LoadNaverMapsScriptOptions`
- Loader options such as `ncpKeyId`, `timeoutMs`, and `nonce` are passed as is.

## Context value details

- `sdkStatus`
- `idle | loading | ready | error` state machine.
- `sdkError`
- Saves the last SDK error.
- `reloadSdk()`
- Rerun SDK loading manually.
- `retrySdk()`
- Alias ​​for `reloadSdk`.
- `clearSdkError()`
- Clears the error state and returns the state to `idle` if necessary.
- `submodules`
- List of loaded submodules.
- `map` _(deprecated)_
- Maintained for backwards compatibility. We recommend using the `useMapInstance()` hook.
- `setMap` _(deprecated)_
- Maintained for backwards compatibility. We recommend using `MapInstanceContext`.

## Architecture

`NaverMapProvider` is only responsible for SDK loading and authentication. Map/panorama instances are provided by `NaverMap` and `Panorama` components respectively as `MapInstanceContext.Provider`.

```
NaverMapProvider (SDK loading/authentication)
├── NaverMap (MapInstanceContext.Provider)
│ ├── Marker (use map instance with useMapInstance)
│   └── Polyline
└── Panorama (MapInstanceContext.Provider)
└── Marker (use panorama instance with useMapInstance)
```

---

## Source File: api/hooks.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/hooks
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/hooks.md

# Hooks

## Type definition

```ts
export interface UseNaverMapOptions {
  requireReady?: boolean;
  requireMapInstance?: boolean;
}

export function useNaverMap(options: UseNaverMapOptions = {}): NaverMapContextValue;

export function useNaverMapInstance(
  options: { requireReady?: boolean } = {}
): naver.maps.Map | null;

export interface MapInstanceContextValue {
  instance: naver.maps.Map | naver.maps.Panorama | null;
  setInstance: (instance: naver.maps.Map | naver.maps.Panorama | null) => void;
  type: "map" | "panorama";
}

export function useMapInstance(): MapInstanceContextValue | null;

export function useMapInstanceRequired(): MapInstanceContextValue;

export function useMap(): naver.maps.Map | null;

export function usePanoramaInstance(): naver.maps.Panorama | null;
```

## useNaverMap

Get the full context value of the Provider.

- `requireReady?: boolean`
- If `true` and `sdkStatus !== "ready"`, throw an exception.
- `requireMapInstance?: boolean`
- If `true` and `map` does not exist, throw an exception.

Exception case:

- Called outside of `NaverMapProvider`
- `requireReady` condition not met
- `requireMapInstance` condition not met

## useNaverMapInstance

This is a convenience hook to use when only a map instance is needed.

- Return type: `naver.maps.Map | null`
- If `requireReady` is `true`, an exception is thrown in the pre-SDK ready state.

## useMapInstance

Get the instance context of the nearest `NaverMap` or `Panorama`.

- Return type: `MapInstanceContextValue | null`
- Returns a value only inside `NaverMap` or `Panorama`.
- The `type` field allows you to distinguish whether the current instance is a map or a panorama.

```tsx
function MyOverlay() {
  const context = useMapInstance();

  if (!context) return null;

  if (context.type === "map") {
    const map = context.instance as naver.maps.Map;
// map-specific logic
  } else {
    const panorama = context.instance as naver.maps.Panorama;
// logic dedicated to panorama
  }
}
```

## useMapInstanceRequired

Same as `useMapInstance`, but throws an exception if there is no context.

- Return type: `MapInstanceContextValue`
- An exception occurs if called outside of `NaverMap` or `Panorama`

```tsx
function MyOverlay() {
  const { instance, type } = useMapInstanceRequired();
// instance always exists (except if it does not exist)
}
```

## useMap

Only get the map instance of the closest `NaverMap`.

- Return type: `naver.maps.Map | null`
- Returns `null` inside `Panorama`
- Return map instance only inside `NaverMap`

```tsx
function MapOnlyOverlay() {
  const map = useMap();

  if (!map) return null;

// map-specific logic
}
```

## usePanoramaInstance

Get only the closest panorama instance of `Panorama`.

- Return type: `naver.maps.Panorama | null`
- `null` is returned inside `NaverMap`
- Return panorama instance only inside `Panorama`

```tsx
function PanoramaOnlyOverlay() {
  const panorama = usePanoramaInstance();

  if (!panorama) return null;

// logic dedicated to panorama
}
```

## Hook Selection Guide

| Use | Recommended Hook |
| -------------------------- | ----------------------- |
| Check SDK status | `useNaverMap()` |
| map/panorama common overlay | `useMapInstance()` |
| map-only component | `useMap()` |
| panorama-specific components | `usePanoramaInstance()` |
| Maintaining legacy code | `useNaverMapInstance()` |

---

## Source File: api/load-script.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/load-script
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/load-script.md

# loadNaverMapsScript

This is a utility function used when manually loading the Naver Maps SDK.

## Signature

```ts
export interface LoadNaverMapsScriptOptions {
  ncpKeyId?: string;
  ncpClientId?: string;
  govClientId?: string;
  finClientId?: string;
  submodules?: string[];
  timeoutMs?: number;
  nonce?: string;
}

export function loadNaverMapsScript(options: LoadNaverMapsScriptOptions): Promise<void>;
```

## Type definition details

- `ncpKeyId?: string`
- This is the default recommended key. If present, it will be used first.
- `ncpClientId?: string`
- This is a legacy compatible key.
- `govClientId?: string`
- This is a public legacy compatible key.
- `finClientId?: string`
- Legacy compatible keys for finance.
- `submodules?: string[]`
- List of submodules `"geocoder"`, `"panorama"`, `"drawing"`, `"visualization"`, `"gl"`.
- `"gl"` cannot be used with other submodules.
- `timeoutMs?: number`
- Timeout (ms) waiting for script loading/SDK preparation. The default is `10000`.
- `nonce?: string`
- Specify the script nonce in the CSP environment.

## Behavior Rules

- For browser only. It is rejected in an SSR environment.
- If requests are made to the same URL simultaneously, the in-flight promise is reused internally to prevent duplicate loading.
- Converts authentication failure to an error by connecting `window.navermap_authFailure`.
- If the same SDK script is already in the DOM, the load/error of the script is reused.

---

## Source File: api/map.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/map
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/map.md

# NaverMap

`NaverMap` is an API that wraps `naver.maps.Map` in React components.

## public type

```ts
interface NaverMapOptionProps {
  background?: string;
  baseTileOpacity?: number;
  bounds?: naver.maps.Bounds | naver.maps.BoundsLiteral;
  center?: naver.maps.Coord | naver.maps.CoordLiteral;
  defaultCenter?: naver.maps.Coord | naver.maps.CoordLiteral;
  zoom?: number;
  defaultZoom?: number;
  disableDoubleClickZoom?: boolean;
  disableDoubleTapZoom?: boolean;
  disableKineticPan?: boolean;
  disableTwoFingerTapZoom?: boolean;
  draggable?: boolean;
  keyboardShortcuts?: boolean;
  logoControl?: boolean;
  logoControlOptions?: naver.maps.LogoControlOptions;
  mapDataControl?: boolean;
  mapDataControlOptions?: naver.maps.MapDataControlOptions;
  mapTypeControl?: boolean;
  mapTypeControlOptions?: naver.maps.MapTypeControlOptions;
  mapTypeId?: naver.maps.MapTypeIdLiteral;
  mapTypes?: naver.maps.MapTypeRegistry;
  maxBounds?: naver.maps.Bounds | naver.maps.BoundsLiteral;
  maxZoom?: number;
  minZoom?: number;
  padding?: naver.maps.padding;
  pinchZoom?: boolean;
  resizeOrigin?: naver.maps.Position;
  scaleControl?: boolean;
  scaleControlOptions?: naver.maps.ScaleControlOptions;
  scrollWheel?: boolean;
  size?: naver.maps.Size | naver.maps.SizeLiteral;
  overlayZoomEffect?: null | string;
  tileSpare?: number;
  tileTransition?: boolean;
  tileDuration?: number;
  zoomControl?: boolean;
  zoomControlOptions?: naver.maps.ZoomControlOptions;
  zoomOrigin?: naver.maps.Coord | naver.maps.CoordLiteral;
  blankTileImage?: null | string;
  gl?: boolean;
  customStyleId?: string;
}

interface NaverMapLifecycleProps {
  children?: React.ReactNode;
  onMapReady?: (map: naver.maps.Map) => void;
  onMapDestroy?: () => void;
  onMapError?: (error: Error) => void;
  retryOnError?: boolean;
  retryDelayMs?: number;
  fallback?: React.ReactNode;
  suspense?: boolean;
}

interface NaverMapEventProps {
  onAddLayer?: (layer: naver.maps.Layer) => void;
  onBoundsChanged?: (bounds: naver.maps.Bounds) => void;
  onCenterChanged?: (center: naver.maps.Coord) => void;
  onCenterPointChanged?: (centerPoint: naver.maps.Point) => void;
  onClick?: (pointerEvent: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => void;
  onDblClick?: (pointerEvent: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => void;
  onDoubleTap?: (pointerEvent: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => void;
  onDrag?: (pointerEvent: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => void;
  onDragEnd?: (pointerEvent: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => void;
  onDragStart?: (pointerEvent: naver.maps.PointerEvent) => void;
  onIdle?: () => void;
  onInit?: () => void;
  onKeyDown?: (keyboardEvent: KeyboardEvent) => void;
  onKeyUp?: (keyboardEvent: KeyboardEvent) => void;
```
