- The map's zoom level must be high enough for FlightSpot POIs to be visible.
- Automatically organized when unmounted.

---

## Source File: api/heat-map.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/heat-map
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/heat-map.md

# HeatMap

`HeatMap` is an API that wraps `naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap` in a React component. Provides a heat map that represents density in color.

::: warning submodule required
This component requires the `visualization` submodule.

```tsx
<NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId="..." submodules={["visualization"]}>
```

:::

## Basic usage

```tsx
import { NaverMap, HeatMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithHeatMap() {
  const data = [
    { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978, weight: 10 },
    { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979, weight: 5 },
    { lat: 37.5667, lng: 126.98, weight: 8 }
  ];

  return (
    <NaverMap
      defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      defaultZoom={14}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <HeatMap data={data} radius={20} opacity={0.6} />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

## public type

```ts
interface HeatMapOptionProps {
  data:
    | naver.maps.LatLng[]
    | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[]
    | naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation[]
    | Array<{ lat: number; lng: number; weight?: number }>;
  opacity?: number;
  radius?: number;
  colorMap?: naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle;
  colorMapReverse?: boolean;
}

interface HeatMapProps extends HeatMapOptionProps {
  onHeatMapReady?: (heatMap: naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap) => void;
}

interface HeatMapRef {
  getInstance: () => naver.maps.visualization.HeatMap | null;
  getMap: () => naver.maps.Map | null;
  setData: (data: LatLng[] | PointArrayLiteral[] | WeightedLocation[]) => void;
  addData: (data: LatLng | PointArrayLiteral | WeightedLocation) => void;
  redraw: () => void;
}
```

## Option properties

| Prop              | Type                             | Default | Description             |
| ----------------- | -------------------------------- | ------- | ----------------------- |
| `data` | `LatLng[] \| WeightedLocation[]` | - | Visualize data (required) |
| `radius` | `number` | `20` | radius (pixels) |
| `opacity` | `number` | `0.6` | Opacity (0-1) |
| `colorMap` | `SpectrumStyle` | - | color spectrum |
| `colorMapReverse` | `boolean` | `false` | Spectral Color Inversion |
| `onHeatMapReady` | `(heatMap) => void` | - | Instance creation completion callback |

## Ref method

| Method          | Return Type      | Description      |
| --------------- | ---------------- | ---------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `HeatMap` | HeatMap instance |
| `getMap()` | `naver.maps.Map` | map instance |
| `setData()` | `void` | data settings |
| `addData()` | `void` | Add data |
| `redraw()` | `void` | Redraw |

## Supported data format

```tsx
// 1. Array of objects (with weight) - most convenient format
const data1 = [
  { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978, weight: 10 },
  { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979, weight: 5 }
];

// 2. Object array (no weight)
const data2 = [
  { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 },
  { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979 }
];

// 3. naver.maps.LatLng array
const data3 = [new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5665, 126.978), new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5666, 126.979)];

// 4. WeightedLocation array
const data4 = [
  new naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation(37.5665, 126.978, 10),
  new naver.maps.visualization.WeightedLocation(37.5666, 126.979, 5)
];
```

## Color Spectrum (SpectrumStyle)

| spectrum | Description |
| ---------- | ----------------------- |
| `RAINBOW` | rainbow colors |
| `JET` | Jet color |
| `HSV` | HSV color space |
| `HOT` | Hot colors (black → red) |
| `COOL` | Cool colors (cyan→magenta) |
| `GREYS` | gray series |
| `YIGnBu` | Yellow→Green→Blue |
| `YIOrRd` | Yellow→Orange→Red |
| `RdBu` | red → blue |
| `PORTLAND` | Portland Colors |
| `OXYGEN` | Oxygen Colors |

```tsx
<HeatMap data={data} colorMap={naver.maps.visualization.SpectrumStyle.JET} colorMapReverse={true} />
```

## Behavior Rules

- Can only be used inside `NaverMap`.
- Can be used only when the `visualization` submodule is loaded.
- Object arrays of the form `{ lat, lng, weight }` are automatically converted to `WeightedLocation`.
- When props are changed, `setData()`, `setOptions()`, and `redraw()` are automatically called.
- When unmounted, it is organized as `setMap(null)`.

---

## Source File: api/dot-map.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/dot-map
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/dot-map.md

# DotMap

`DotMap` is an API that wraps `naver.maps.visualization.DotMap` in React components. It provides a point map that represents individual locations as dots.

::: warning submodule required
This component requires the `visualization` submodule.

```tsx
<NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId="..." submodules={["visualization"]}>
```

:::

## Basic usage

```tsx
import { NaverMap, DotMap } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapWithDotMap() {
  const data = [
    { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 },
    { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979 },
    { lat: 37.5667, lng: 126.98 }
  ];

  return (
    <NaverMap
      defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
      defaultZoom={14}
      style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
    >
      <DotMap
        data={data}
        radius={5}
        opacity={0.8}
        fillColor="#03C75A"
        strokeColor="#ffffff"
        strokeWeight={1}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

## public type

```ts
interface DotMapOptionProps {
  data: naver.maps.LatLng[] | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[] | Array<{ lat: number; lng: number }>;
  opacity?: number;
  radius?: number;
  strokeWeight?: number;
  strokeColor?: string;
  strokeLineCap?: "butt" | "round" | "square";
  strokeLineJoin?: "bevel" | "miter" | "round";
  fillColor?: string;
}

interface DotMapProps extends DotMapOptionProps {
  onDotMapReady?: (dotMap: naver.maps.visualization.DotMap) => void;
}

interface DotMapRef {
  getInstance: () => naver.maps.visualization.DotMap | null;
  getMap: () => naver.maps.Map | null;
  setData: (data: naver.maps.LatLng[] | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral[]) => void;
  addData: (data: naver.maps.LatLng | naver.maps.PointArrayLiteral) => void;
  redraw: () => void;
}
```

## Option properties

| Prop             | Type                            | Default     | Description             |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------- | ----------- | ----------------------- |
| `data` | `LatLng[] \| object[]` | - | Visualize data (required) |
| `radius` | `number` | `5` | point radius (pixels) |
| `opacity` | `number` | `0.6` | Opacity (0-1) |
| `fillColor` | `string` | `"#ff0000"` | fill color |
| `strokeColor` | `string` | `"#fff"` | border color |
| `strokeWeight` | `number` | `1` | border thickness |
| `strokeLineCap` | `"butt" \| "round" \| "square"` | `"round"` | Line End Style |
| `strokeLineJoin` | `"bevel" \| "miter" \| "round"` | `"round"` | Line connection style |
| `onDotMapReady` | `(dotMap) => void` | - | Instance creation completion callback |

## Ref method

| Method          | Return Type      | Description     |
| --------------- | ---------------- | --------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `DotMap` | DotMap instance |
| `getMap()` | `naver.maps.Map` | map instance |
| `setData()` | `void` | data settings |
| `addData()` | `void` | Add data |
| `redraw()` | `void` | Redraw |

## Supported data format

```tsx
// 1. Object array - the most convenient format
const data1 = [
  { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 },
  { lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.979 }
];

// 2. naver.maps.LatLng array
const data2 = [new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5665, 126.978), new naver.maps.LatLng(37.5666, 126.979)];

// 3. PointArrayLiteral array
const data3 = [
  [37.5665, 126.978],
  [37.5666, 126.979]
];
```

## Behavior Rules

- Can only be used inside `NaverMap`.
- Can be used only when the `visualization` submodule is loaded.
- Object arrays in the form `{ lat, lng }` are automatically converted to `LatLng`.
- When props are changed, `setData()`, `setOptions()`, and `redraw()` are automatically called.
- When unmounted, it is organized as `setMap(null)`.

---

## Source File: api/drawing-manager.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/api/drawing-manager
- Local Path: packages/docs/api/drawing-manager.md

# DrawingManager

`DrawingManager` is an API that wraps `naver.maps.drawing.DrawingManager` in React components. It provides a graphical interface that allows users to draw and edit shapes on the map.

::: warning submodule required
This component requires the `drawing` submodule.

```tsx
<NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId="..." submodules={["drawing"]}>
```

:::

## Basic usage

```tsx
import { NaverMap, DrawingManager } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MyMap() {
  return (
    <NaverMap defaultCenter={{ lat: 37.5666, lng: 126.9784 }} defaultZoom={14}>
      <DrawingManager
        drawingControl={[
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.RECTANGLE,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ELLIPSE,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYLINE,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYGON,
          naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.MARKER
        ]}
      />
    </NaverMap>
  );
}
```

## public type

```ts
interface DrawingManagerOptionProps {
  drawingControl?: DrawingMode[] | null;
  drawingControlOptions?: DrawingControlOptions;
  drawingMode?: DrawingMode;
  controlPointOptions?: DrawingControlPointOptions;
  rectangleOptions?: RectangleOptions;
  ellipseOptions?: EllipseOptions;
  polylineOptions?: PolylineOptions;
  arrowlineOptions?: PolylineOptions;
  polygonOptions?: PolygonOptions;
  markerOptions?: MarkerOptions;
}

interface DrawingManagerEventProps {
  onDrawingAdded?: (overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void;
  onDrawingRemoved?: (overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void;
  onDrawingSelect?: (overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void;
  onDrawingStart?: (overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void;
  onDrawingCanceled?: (overlay: DrawingOverlay) => void;
  onDrawingManagerReady?: (manager: DrawingManager) => void;
}

interface DrawingManagerRef {
  getInstance: () => DrawingManager | null;
  getMap: () => Map | null;
  getDrawings: () => Record<string, DrawingOverlay>;
  getDrawing: (id: string) => DrawingOverlay | undefined;
  addDrawing: (overlay: DrawingOverlay, mode: DrawingMode, id?: string) => void;
  removeDrawing: (overlayOrId: DrawingOverlay | string) => void;
  toGeoJson: () => object;
  setDrawingMode: (mode: DrawingMode) => void;
  getDrawingMode: () => DrawingMode | undefined;
}
```

## Option properties

| Prop                    | Type                         | Default   | Description                                      |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------- | --------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| `drawingControl` | `DrawingMode[] \| null` | All Tools | List of drawing tools to display. If `null`, hide tool UI |
| `drawingControlOptions` | `DrawingControlOptions` | - | Position and style of drawing tool controls |
| `drawingMode` | `DrawingMode` | `HAND` | Initial drawing mode |
| `controlPointOptions` | `DrawingControlPointOptions` | - | Edit Control Point Options |
| `rectangleOptions` | `RectangleOptions` | - | Rectangle Shape Options |
| `ellipseOptions` | `EllipseOptions` | - | Ellipse shape options |
| `polylineOptions` | `PolylineOptions` | - | Polyline Geometry Options |
| `arrowlineOptions` | `PolylineOptions` | - | Arrow Polyline Options |
| `polygonOptions` | `PolygonOptions` | - | polygon shape options |
| `markerOptions` | `MarkerOptions` | - | marker options |

## Event properties

| Prop                    | Type                | Description           |
| ----------------------- | ------------------- | --------------------- |
| `onDrawingAdded` | `(overlay) => void` | When a shape is added |
| `onDrawingRemoved` | `(overlay) => void` | When a shape is deleted |
| `onDrawingSelect` | `(overlay) => void` | When a shape is selected |
| `onDrawingStart` | `(overlay) => void` | When drawing begins |
| `onDrawingCanceled` | `(overlay) => void` | When drawing is canceled |
| `onDrawingManagerReady` | `(manager) => void` | When manager initialization is complete |

## Ref method

| Method             | Return Type                      | Description               |
| ------------------ | -------------------------------- | ------------------------- |
| `getInstance()` | `DrawingManager` | native instance |
| `getMap()` | `Map` | associated Map instance |
| `getDrawings()` | `Record<string, DrawingOverlay>` | All drawn geometric objects |
| `getDrawing(id)` | `DrawingOverlay` | Shape object with specific ID |
| `addDrawing()` | `void` | Add shape |
| `removeDrawing()` | `void` | Delete shape |
| `toGeoJson()` | `object` | Export to GeoJSON format |
| `setDrawingMode()` | `void` | Change drawing mode |
| `getDrawingMode()` | `DrawingMode` | Current drawing mode |

## DrawingMode

```tsx
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.HAND; //default mode (drawing disabled)
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.RECTANGLE; // square
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ELLIPSE; // Ellipse
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYLINE; // polyline
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.ARROWLINE; // arrow polyline
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.POLYGON; // polygon
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingMode.MARKER; // marker
```

## DrawingControlOptions

```tsx
interface DrawingControlOptions {
  position?: naver.maps.Position;
  style?: naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle;
}
```

### Location options

```tsx
naver.maps.Position.TOP_LEFT;
naver.maps.Position.TOP_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.TOP_RIGHT;
naver.maps.Position.LEFT_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.RIGHT_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_LEFT;
naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_CENTER;
naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_RIGHT;
```

### Style Options

```tsx
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.HORIZONTAL;
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.HORIZONTAL_2;
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.VERTICAL;
naver.maps.drawing.DrawingStyle.VERTICAL_2;
```

## Customizing shape style

```tsx
<DrawingManager
  rectangleOptions={{
    fillColor: "#ff0000",
    fillOpacity: 0.3,
    strokeWeight: 2,
    strokeColor: "#ff0000"
  }}
  ellipseOptions={{
    fillColor: "#00ff00",
    fillOpacity: 0.3,
    strokeWeight: 2,
    strokeColor: "#00ff00"
  }}
  polylineOptions={{
    strokeColor: "#0000ff",
    strokeWeight: 3
  }}
  polygonOptions={{
    fillColor: "#ffff00",
    fillOpacity: 0.3,
    strokeWeight: 2,
    strokeColor: "#ffd100"
  }}
/>
```

## GeoJSON export

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { DrawingManager, type DrawingManagerRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MyMap() {
  const drawingRef = useRef<DrawingManagerRef>(null);

  const handleExport = () => {
    const geoJson = drawingRef.current?.toGeoJson();
    console.log(JSON.stringify(geoJson, null, 2));
  };

  return (
    <>
      <DrawingManager ref={drawingRef} />
<button onClick={handleExport}>Export GeoJSON</button>
    </>
  );
}
```

## Behavior Rules

- Can only be used inside `NaverMap`.
- Can be used only when the `drawing` submodule is loaded.
- **Left mouse click**: Select and edit shapes
- **Right mouse click**: Delete shape
- **HAND MODE**: Disable drawing, only basic map operations are possible.
- **Polyline/Polygon**: Add points by clicking, complete by double clicking
- Circle is replaced by Ellipse.

---

## Source File: examples/markers.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/markers
- Local Path: packages/docs/examples/markers.md

# Display marker

This page explains how to use various markers with examples.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="marker" height="450px" />

## Default marker

The simplest way to display markers is:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function BasicMarker() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
<Marker position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} title="Seoul City Hall" />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Required Props

| Prop | Type | Description |
| ---------- | -------------- | ---------------- |
| `position` | `{ lat, lng }` | Marker location (required) |

### Frequently used props

```tsx
<Marker
  position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
title="tooltip text"
  clickable={true}
  draggable={true}
  visible={true}
  zIndex={100}
/>
```

## Marker event

Handle events such as marker clicks, drags, etc.:

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MarkerWithEvents() {
  const [selectedPosition, setSelectedPosition] = useState(null);

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
          zoom={14}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        >
          <Marker
            position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
            draggable
            onClick={(e) => {
console.log("Marker clicked!", e.coord);
              setSelectedPosition(e.coord);
            }}
            onDragEnd={(e) => {
console.log("New location:", e.coord);
              setSelectedPosition(e.coord);
            }}
          />
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      {selectedPosition && (
        <p>
Selected Position: {selectedPosition.lat.toFixed(4)}, {selectedPosition.lng.toFixed(4)}
        </p>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Available events

| Event | Description |
| -------------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| `onClick` | Click |
| `onDblClick` | Double click |
| `onRightClick` | Right click |
| `onMouseDown` / `onMouseUp` | mouse press/release |
| `onMouseOver` / `onMouseOut` | Mouseover/Out |
| `onDragStart` / `onDrag` / `onDragEnd` | Drag start/proceed/end |

## Custom marker (React component)

Use a React component with `children` as the marker icon:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function CustomMarkerExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
{/* custom style marker */}
        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}>
          <div
            style={{
              padding: "8px 16px",
              background: "#03C75A",
              color: "white",
              borderRadius: "20px",
              fontWeight: "bold",
              boxShadow: "0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)"
            }}
          >
Naver
          </div>
        </Marker>

{/* Emoji marker */}
        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.568, lng: 126.978 }}>
          <div style={{ fontSize: "32px" }}>📍</div>
        </Marker>

{/* image marker */}
        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.565, lng: 126.978 }}>
<img src="/marker-icon.png" alt="Marker" style={{ width: 40, height: 40 }} />
        </Marker>
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Set anchor point

Adjust the center point of a custom marker:

```tsx
<Marker
  position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
  icon={{
    content: `<div style="font-size: 32px">📍</div>`,
anchor: new naver.maps.Point(16, 32) // Bottom center
  }}
/>
```

## Display multiple markers

Render multiple markers with array data:

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

const locations = [
{ id: 1, name: "Seoul Station", lat: 37.5547, lng: 126.9707 },
{ id: 2, name: "Gangnam Station", lat: 37.4981, lng: 127.0276 },
{ id: 3, name: "Jamsil Station", lat: 37.5133, lng: 127.1 },
{ id: 4, name: "Hongik University Station", lat: 37.5572, lng: 126.9245 },
{ id: 5, name: "Sinchon Station", lat: 37.5551, lng: 126.9368 }
];

function MultipleMarkers() {
  const [selected, setSelected] = useState(null);

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.54, lng: 126.98 }}
          zoom={12}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
        >
          {locations.map((loc) => (
            <Marker
              key={loc.id}
              position={{ lat: loc.lat, lng: loc.lng }}
              title={loc.name}
              onClick={() => setSelected(loc)}
            />
          ))}
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      {selected && (
        <div className="info-panel">
          <h3>{selected.name}</h3>
<p>Latitude: {selected.lat}</p>
<p>Longitude: {selected.lng}</p>
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Marker animation

Animate the marker:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function AnimatedMarker() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} animation={naver.maps.Animation.BOUNCE} />

        <Marker position={{ lat: 37.568, lng: 126.978 }} animation={naver.maps.Animation.DROP} />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Animation type

| animation | Description |
| ---------- | ------------------- |
| `BOUNCE` | Continuing to plump and bounce |
| `DROP` | Falling from above (1 time) |

## Marker control with Ref

Control markers directly via Ref:

```tsx
import { useRef, useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, NaverMapProvider, type MarkerRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MarkerWithRef() {
  const markerRef = useRef<MarkerRef>(null);
  const [position, setPosition] = useState({ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 });

  const moveMarker = () => {
    const newPos = {
      lat: 37.5665 + (Math.random() - 0.5) * 0.01,
      lng: 126.978 + (Math.random() - 0.5) * 0.01
    };
    markerRef.current?.setPosition(newPos);
    setPosition(newPos);
  };

  const getMarkerInfo = () => {
    const pos = markerRef.current?.getPosition();
console.log("Current location:", pos);
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap center={position} zoom={14} style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}>
          <Marker ref={markerRef} position={position} draggable />
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      <div style={{ marginTop: "1rem" }}>
<button onClick={moveMarker}>Random move</button>
<button onClick={getMarkerInfo}>Check location</button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Bulk markers and clustering

For dozens or more markers, use `MarkerClusterer`. For more information, see [Marker Clustering](/examples/clustering).

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, MarkerClusterer, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

// 100 random markers
const markers = Array.from({ length: 100 }, (_, i) => ({
  id: i,
  lat: 37.5 + Math.random() * 0.1,
  lng: 126.9 + Math.random() * 0.1
}));

function ClusteredMarkers() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 126.95 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <MarkerClusterer>
          {markers.map((m) => (
            <Marker key={m.id} clustererItemId={m.id} position={{ lat: m.lat, lng: m.lng }} />
          ))}
        </MarkerClusterer>
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Linking marker and InfoWindow

Display an info window when a marker is clicked:

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, InfoWindow, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

const places = [
{ id: 1, name: "Seoul Station", lat: 37.5547, lng: 126.9707, desc: "Seoul's central station" },
{ id: 2, name: "Gangnam Station", lat: 37.4981, lng: 127.0276, desc: "The station with the most floating population" }
];

function MarkerWithInfoWindow() {
  const [selected, setSelected] = useState(null);

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.52, lng: 127.0 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        {places.map((place) => (
          <Marker
            key={place.id}
            position={{ lat: place.lat, lng: place.lng }}
            onClick={() => setSelected(place)}
          />
        ))}

        {selected && (
          <InfoWindow
            position={{ lat: selected.lat, lng: selected.lng }}
            visible
            onCloseClick={() => setSelected(null)}
          >
            <div style={{ padding: "10px" }}>
              <strong>{selected.name}</strong>
              <p>{selected.desc}</p>
            </div>
          </InfoWindow>
        )}
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Next steps

- [Show information window](/examples/info-window) - Details on using InfoWindow
- [Marker Clustering](/examples/clustering) - Bulk marker processing
- [Marker API](/api/marker) - Full list of Props

---

## Source File: examples/info-window.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/info-window
- Local Path: packages/docs/examples/info-window.md

# Open information window

This explains how to display an information pop-up on a map using the `InfoWindow` component.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="infowindow" height="450px" />

## Default InfoWindow

```tsx
import { NaverMap, InfoWindow, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function BasicInfoWindow() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <InfoWindow position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} visible>
          <div style={{ padding: "10px" }}>
<strong>Seoul City Hall</strong>
<p>110 Sejong-daero, Jung-gu, Seoul</p>
          </div>
        </InfoWindow>
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Link with marker

A common pattern for displaying an InfoWindow when a marker is clicked:

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, InfoWindow, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

const places = [
{ id: 1, name: "Seoul Station", lat: 37.5547, lng: 126.9707 },
{ id: 2, name: "Gangnam Station", lat: 37.4981, lng: 127.0276 },
{ id: 3, name: "Jamsil Station", lat: 37.5133, lng: 127.1 }
];

function MarkerWithPopup() {
  const [selectedId, setSelectedId] = useState(null);
  const selectedPlace = places.find((p) => p.id === selectedId);

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.52, lng: 127.0 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        {places.map((place) => (
          <Marker
            key={place.id}
            position={{ lat: place.lat, lng: place.lng }}
            onClick={() => setSelectedId(place.id)}
          />
        ))}

        {selectedPlace && (
          <InfoWindow
            position={{ lat: selectedPlace.lat, lng: selectedPlace.lng }}
            visible
            onCloseClick={() => setSelectedId(null)}
          >
            <div style={{ padding: "12px", minWidth: "150px" }}>
              <strong style={{ fontSize: "16px" }}>{selectedPlace.name}</strong>
              <button onClick={() => setSelectedId(null)} style={{ float: "right" }}>
                ✕
              </button>
            </div>
          </InfoWindow>
        )}
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Custom Style InfoWindow

Customize background color, borders, size, and more:

```tsx
<InfoWindow
  position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
  visible
  backgroundColor="#ffffff"
  borderColor="#03C75A"
  borderWidth={2}
  maxWidth={300}
  disableAutoPan={false}
>
  <div style={{ padding: "16px" }}>
<h3 style={{ margin: "0 0 8px", color: "#03C75A" }}>Custom InfoWindow</h3>
<p style={{ margin: 0 }}>You can adjust background color, border, maximum width, etc.</p>
  </div>
</InfoWindow>
```

### Style Props

| Prop | Description | default |
| ----------------- | ----------- | ------------- |
| `backgroundColor` | background color | white |
| `borderColor` | border color | gray |
| `borderWidth` | border thickness | 1 |
| `maxWidth` | max width | Unlimited |
| `disableAnchor` | hide tail | false |
| `anchorColor` | tail color | Same as background color |

## Use anchor marker

Anchor an InfoWindow to a specific marker with the `anchor` prop:

```tsx
import { useRef, useState } from "react";
import {
  NaverMap,
  Marker,
  InfoWindow,
  NaverMapProvider,
  type MarkerRef
} from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function InfoWindowWithAnchor() {
  const markerRef = useRef<MarkerRef>(null);
  const [showInfo, setShowInfo] = useState(false);

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={14}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Marker
          ref={markerRef}
          position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
          onClick={() => setShowInfo(!showInfo)}
        />

        <InfoWindow
          anchor={markerRef.current?.getInstance()}
          visible={showInfo}
pixelOffset={{ x: 0, y: -40 }} // offset above marker
        >
<div style={{ padding: "12px" }}>InfoWindow anchored to marker</div>
        </InfoWindow>
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Automatic panning control

Controls the automatic movement of the map when the InfoWindow is opened:

```tsx
<InfoWindow
  position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
  visible
disableAutoPan={true} // Disable auto panning
autoPanPadding={{ x: 50, y: 50 }} // panning margin
>
<div>InfoWindow with auto-panning disabled</div>
</InfoWindow>
```

## Event handling

Handle InfoWindow open/close events:

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, InfoWindow, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function InfoWindowEvents() {
  const [visible, setVisible] = useState(true);

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
          zoom={14}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        >
          <InfoWindow
            position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
            visible={visible}
onOpen={() => console.log("InfoWindow opens")}
onClose={() => console.log("InfoWindow closed")}
          >
            <div style={{ padding: "10px" }}>
<button onClick={() => setVisible(false)}>Close</button>
            </div>
          </InfoWindow>
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

{!visible && <button onClick={() => setVisible(true)}>Open InfoWindow</button>}
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Controlling with Ref

Control the InfoWindow directly via Ref:

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { NaverMap, InfoWindow, NaverMapProvider, type InfoWindowRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function InfoWindowWithRef() {
  const infoRef = useRef<InfoWindowRef>(null);

  const updateContent = () => {
infoRef.current?.setContent("Change with new content!");
  };

  const closeWindow = () => {
    infoRef.current?.close();
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
          zoom={14}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        >
          <InfoWindow ref={infoRef} position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }} visible>
<div style={{ padding: "10px" }}>Initial content</div>
          </InfoWindow>
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      <div style={{ marginTop: "1rem" }}>
<button onClick={updateContent}>Change content</button>
<button onClick={closeWindow}>Close</button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Tips

### 1. Managing multiple InfoWindows

To display only one InfoWindow at a time:

```tsx
function SingleInfoWindow() {
  const [openId, setOpenId] = useState(null);

  return (
    <>
      {markers.map((m) => (
        <Marker
          key={m.id}
          position={m.position}
onClick={() => setOpenId(m.id)} // Other InfoWindows are automatically closed
        />
      ))}

      {openId && (
        <InfoWindow position={getMarkerPosition(openId)} visible>
{/* detail */}
        </InfoWindow>
      )}
    </>
  );
}
```

### 2. Use pure HTML without React Portal

You can also pass an HTML string directly as the `content` prop:

```tsx
<InfoWindow
  position={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
content="<div style='padding:10px'><strong>HTML content</strong></div>"
  visible
/>
```

### 3. Performance optimization

If your InfoWindow content is complex, use memoization:

```tsx
const infoContent = useMemo(
  () => (
    <div>
      <h3>{place.name}</h3>
      <p>{place.description}</p>
    </div>
  ),
  [place]
);

<InfoWindow visible>{infoContent}</InfoWindow>;
```

## Next steps

- [Draw shapes](/examples/shapes) - How to use Circle, Polygon
- [InfoWindow API](/api/info-window) - Full list of Props

---

## Source File: examples/shapes.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/shapes
- Local Path: packages/docs/examples/shapes.md

# Draw shapes

Explains how to display areas on a map with shape overlays such as `Circle`, `Polygon`, and `Polyline`.

## Live Demo

### Circle

<DemoEmbed demo="circle" height="400px" />

### Polygon

<DemoEmbed demo="polygon" height="400px" />

### Polyline

<DemoEmbed demo="polyline" height="400px" />

## Circle

Displays a radius centered on a specific location:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Circle, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function CircleExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Circle
          center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
radius={1000} // in meters
          strokeColor="#03C75A"
          strokeWeight={2}
          strokeOpacity={0.8}
          fillColor="#03C75A"
          fillOpacity={0.2}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Circle Props

| Prop | Type | default | Description |
| --------------- | -------------------------- | --------- | --------------------- |
| `center` | `{ lat, lng }` | - | Center of circle (required) |
| `radius` | `number` | `0` | Radius (meters) |
| `strokeColor` | `string` | `#007EEA` | Outline Color |
| `strokeWeight` | `number` | `1` | Outline Thickness |
| `strokeOpacity` | `number` | `1` | Outline Opacity (0~1) |
| `strokeStyle` | `solid` \| `dash` \| `dot` | `solid` | Outline Style |
| `fillColor` | `string` | - | fill color |
| `fillOpacity` | `number` | `1` | Fill Opacity (0~1) |

## Polygon

Displays a polygonal area:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Polygon, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function PolygonExample() {
  const path = [
    { lat: 37.56, lng: 126.97 },
    { lat: 37.57, lng: 126.97 },
    { lat: 37.575, lng: 126.985 },
    { lat: 37.57, lng: 127.0 },
    { lat: 37.56, lng: 127.0 }
  ];

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.565, lng: 126.985 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Polygon
          paths={path}
          strokeColor="#FF6B6B"
          strokeWeight={3}
          fillColor="#FF6B6B"
          fillOpacity={0.3}
          clickable
onClick={(e) => console.log("Polygon clicked", e.coord)}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Multiple polygons (hole drilling)

You can create perforated polygons in several ways:

```tsx
const outerPath = [
  { lat: 37.58, lng: 126.95 },
  { lat: 37.58, lng: 127.0 },
  { lat: 37.55, lng: 127.0 },
  { lat: 37.55, lng: 126.95 }
];

const innerPath = [
  { lat: 37.57, lng: 126.96 },
  { lat: 37.57, lng: 126.99 },
  { lat: 37.56, lng: 126.99 },
  { lat: 37.56, lng: 126.96 }
];

<Polygon
paths={[outerPath, innerPath]} // outer + inner path
  fillColor="#4CAF50"
  fillOpacity={0.4}
/>;
```

## Polyline

Display a path or line:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Polyline, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function PolylineExample() {
  const path = [
{ lat: 37.5547, lng: 126.9707 }, // Seoul Station
{ lat: 37.4981, lng: 127.0276 }, // Gangnam Station
{ lat: 37.5133, lng: 127.1 } // Jamsil Station
  ];

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.52, lng: 127.0 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Polyline
          path={path}
          strokeColor="#2196F3"
          strokeWeight={5}
          strokeOpacity={0.8}
          strokeLineCap="round"
          strokeLineJoin="round"
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Polyline style

```tsx
<Polyline
  path={path}
  strokeColor="#E91E63"
  strokeWeight={4}
strokeStyle="dash" // solid line: solid, dotted line: dash, dot: dot
strokeLineCap="round" // End shape: butt, round, square
strokeLineJoin="round" // Connections: miter, round, bevel
/>
```

## Rectangle

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Rectangle, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function RectangleExample() {
  const bounds = {
    south: 37.55,
    west: 126.95,
    north: 37.58,
    east: 127.0
  };

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.565, lng: 126.975 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Rectangle
          bounds={bounds}
          strokeColor="#9C27B0"
          strokeWeight={2}
          fillColor="#9C27B0"
          fillOpacity={0.2}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Ellipse

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Ellipse, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function EllipseExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Ellipse
          bounds={{
            south: 37.56,
            west: 126.97,
            north: 37.57,
            east: 126.99
          }}
          strokeColor="#FF9800"
          fillColor="#FF9800"
          fillOpacity={0.3}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Practical example: displaying areas on a map

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import {
  NaverMap,
  Circle,
  Polygon,
  Polyline,
  Marker,
  NaverMapProvider
} from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function AreaDisplay() {
  const [mode, setMode] = useState<"circle" | "polygon" | "polyline">("circle");

// serviceable radius
  const serviceAreas = [
    { center: { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }, radius: 2000 },
    { center: { lat: 37.4981, lng: 127.0276 }, radius: 1500 }
  ];

// delivery route
  const deliveryPath = [
    { lat: 37.5547, lng: 126.9707 },
    { lat: 37.56, lng: 126.98 },
    { lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }
  ];

// service area
  const serviceZone = [
    { lat: 37.56, lng: 126.96 },
    { lat: 37.58, lng: 126.96 },
    { lat: 37.58, lng: 127.0 },
    { lat: 37.56, lng: 127.0 }
  ];

  return (
    <div>
      <div style={{ marginBottom: "1rem" }}>
<button onClick={() => setMode("circle")}>Service radius</button>
<button onClick={() => setMode("polygon")}>Service area</button>
<button onClick={() => setMode("polyline")}>Delivery route</button>
      </div>

      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.565, lng: 126.98 }}
          zoom={12}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
        >
          {mode === "circle" &&
            serviceAreas.map((area, i) => (
              <Circle
                key={i}
                center={area.center}
                radius={area.radius}
                strokeColor="#03C75A"
                strokeWeight={2}
                fillColor="#03C75A"
                fillOpacity={0.15}
              />
            ))}

          {mode === "polygon" && (
            <Polygon
              paths={serviceZone}
              strokeColor="#2196F3"
              strokeWeight={3}
              fillColor="#2196F3"
              fillOpacity={0.2}
            />
          )}

          {mode === "polyline" && (
            <>
              <Polyline path={deliveryPath} strokeColor="#FF5722" strokeWeight={4} />
              {deliveryPath.map((point, i) => (
                <Marker key={i} position={point} />
              ))}
            </>
          )}
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Controlling shapes with Ref

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Circle, NaverMapProvider, type CircleRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function ControlledCircle() {
  const circleRef = useRef<CircleRef>(null);
  const [radius, setRadius] = useState(1000);

  const getArea = () => {
    const area = circleRef.current?.getAreaSize();
console.log(`Area: ${area?.toFixed(0)} m²`);
  };

  const getBounds = () => {
    const bounds = circleRef.current?.getBounds();
console.log("Bounds:", bounds);
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
          zoom={13}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        >
          <Circle
            ref={circleRef}
            center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
            radius={radius}
            fillColor="#03C75A"
            fillOpacity={0.3}
          />
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      <div style={{ marginTop: "1rem" }}>
        <label>
Radius: {radius}m
          <input
            type="range"
            min={500}
            max={5000}
            step={100}
            value={radius}
            onChange={(e) => setRadius(Number(e.target.value))}
          />
        </label>
<button onClick={getArea}>Calculate area</button>
<button onClick={getBounds}>Get Bounds</button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Next steps

- [Marker Clustering](/examples/clustering) - Bulk marker processing
- [Circle API](/api/circle) - Circle All Props
- [Polygon API](/api/polygon) - Polygon All Props
- [Polyline API](/api/polyline) - Polyline All Props

---

## Source File: examples/clustering.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/clustering
- Local Path: packages/docs/examples/clustering.md

# Marker clustering

Describes how to use `MarkerClusterer` to efficiently display tens or hundreds of markers.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="clusterer" height="500px" />

## Why do you need clustering?

Problems that arise when there are many markers:

- **Performance degradation**: Generating hundreds of DOM elements
- **Visual congestion**: Difficult to see due to overlapping markers
- **Poor user experience**: Difficult to click on individual markers

`MarkerClusterer` groups nearby markers into one cluster.

## Basic usage

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, MarkerClusterer, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

// sample data (100 markers)
const generateMarkers = (count: number) => {
  return Array.from({ length: count }, (_, i) => ({
    id: i,
    lat: 37.5 + Math.random() * 0.15,
    lng: 126.9 + Math.random() * 0.2,
name: `location ${i + 1}`
  }));
};

const markers = generateMarkers(100);

function BasicClusterer() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 127.0 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <MarkerClusterer>
          {markers.map((m) => (
            <Marker key={m.id} position={{ lat: m.lat, lng: m.lng }} title={m.name} />
          ))}
        </MarkerClusterer>
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Custom cluster icon

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Marker, MarkerClusterer, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function CustomClusterIcon() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 127.0 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <MarkerClusterer
          clusterIcon={({ count }) => (
            <div
              style={{
                width: 50,
                height: 50,
                borderRadius: "50%",
                background: count > 50 ? "#EA4335" : count > 20 ? "#FBBC05" : "#03C75A",
                color: "white",
                display: "flex",
                alignItems: "center",
                justifyContent: "center",
                fontWeight: "bold",
                fontSize: 16,
                boxShadow: "0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)"
              }}
            >
              {count}
            </div>
          )}
        >
          {markers.map((m) => (
            <Marker key={m.id} position={{ lat: m.lat, lng: m.lng }} />
          ))}
        </MarkerClusterer>
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Custom marker icon (children)

Children of `<Marker>` can be displayed with a custom overlay on individual points that are not included in a cluster.

```tsx
<MarkerClusterer
  clusterIcon={({ count }) => (
    <div
      style={{
        width: 44,
        height: 44,
        borderRadius: "50%",
        background: "#FF5722",
        color: "white",
        display: "flex",
        alignItems: "center",
        justifyContent: "center",
        fontWeight: "bold",
        boxShadow: "0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)"
      }}
    >
      {count}
    </div>
  )}
>
  {markers.map((m) => (
    <Marker key={m.id} position={{ lat: m.lat, lng: m.lng }}>
{/* Custom marker to display when it is a single point */}
      <div
        style={{
          width: 28,
          height: 28,
          borderRadius: "50%",
          background: "#03C75A",
          border: "2px solid white",
          boxShadow: "0 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)"
        }}
      />
    </Marker>
  ))}
</MarkerClusterer>
```

## Cluster click event

Clicking on a cluster will zoom into that area or display information:

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, MarkerClusterer, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function ClustererWithClick() {
  const [info, setInfo] = useState<string | null>(null);

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 127.0 }}
          zoom={12}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        >
          <MarkerClusterer
            clusterData={{ includeItems: true }}
            onClusterClick={({ cluster, helpers }) => {
console.log(`Contains ${cluster.count} markers`);

// Check marker data included in the cluster
              if (cluster.items) {
                setInfo(
`${cluster.count} items: ${cluster.items
                    .slice(0, 3)
                    .map((i) => i.data?.name)
                    .join(", ")}...`
                );
              }

// Zoom in to cluster area
              helpers.zoomToCluster(cluster, { maxZoom: 16 });
            }}
          >
            {markers.map((m) => (
              <Marker
                key={m.id}
                position={{ lat: m.lat, lng: m.lng }}
item={m} // data to access from the cluster
              />
            ))}
          </MarkerClusterer>
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      {info && <p>{info}</p>}
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Algorithm selection

Provides three built-in algorithms:

```tsx
// 1. Supercluster (default) - fastest and most accurate
<MarkerClusterer
  algorithm={{
    type: "supercluster",
radius: 60, // cluster radius (pixels)
maxZoom: 16, // no clustering above this zoom
  }}
>
  ...
</MarkerClusterer>

// 2. Grid - grid-based, simple
<MarkerClusterer
  algorithm={{
    type: "grid",
gridSize: 100, // grid size (pixels)
minClusterSize: 2, // minimum cluster size
    maxZoom: 15,
  }}
>
  ...
</MarkerClusterer>

// 3. Radius - distance based
<MarkerClusterer
  algorithm={{
    type: "radius",
radius: 80, // radius (pixels)
    minClusterSize: 2,
  }}
>
  ...
</MarkerClusterer>
```

### Algorithm comparison

| Algorithm | Advantages | Disadvantages | Recommendation situation |
| ---------------- | ------------------------ | ---------------- | -------------------- |
| **supercluster** | Fast, accurate, memory efficient | Settings complicated | Bulk data (default) |
| **grid** | Simple, predictable | May be inaccurate | Uniformly distributed data |
| **radius** | Intuitive | slow | small amount of data |

## Clustering toggle

```tsx
import { useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, MarkerClusterer, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function ToggleableClusterer() {
  const [enabled, setEnabled] = useState(true);

  return (
    <div>
      <button onClick={() => setEnabled(!enabled)}>
{enabled ? "Turn off clustering" : "Turn on clustering"}
      </button>

      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 127.0 }}
          zoom={12}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
        >
          <MarkerClusterer enabled={enabled}>
            {markers.map((m) => (
              <Marker key={m.id} position={{ lat: m.lat, lng: m.lng }} />
            ))}
          </MarkerClusterer>
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>
    </div>
  );
}
```

If `enabled={false}`, each `Marker` will be rendered individually.

## Dynamic data update

Automatically recalculates when marker data changes:

```tsx
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { NaverMap, Marker, MarkerClusterer, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function DynamicClusterer() {
  const [markers, setMarkers] = useState([]);
  const [filter, setFilter] = useState("");

// filtered markers
  const filteredMarkers = markers.filter((m) =>
    m.name.includes(filter)
  );

  useEffect(() => {
// load data
    fetchMarkers().then(setMarkers);
  }, []);

  return (
    <div>
      <input
placeholder="Enter search term"
        value={filter}
        onChange={(e) => setFilter(e.target.value)}
      />
<p>{filteredMarkers.length} markers</p>

      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap ...>
          <MarkerClusterer>
            {filteredMarkers.map((m) => (
              <Marker
                key={m.id}
                position={m.position}
                item={m}
              />
            ))}
          </MarkerClusterer>
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Performance optimization

### 1. `recomputeOn` adjustment

```tsx
<MarkerClusterer
  behavior={{
    recomputeOn: "idle",    // "idle" | "move" | "zoom"
debounceMs: 300, // debounce (default 200ms)
  }}
>
```

- `idle`: Recalculate after completion of map movement (default, recommended)
- `zoom`: Recalculate only when zoom changes
- `move`: Recalculate on every move (be careful with performance)

### 2. Optimizing `clusterData`

```tsx
<MarkerClusterer
  clusterData={{
includeItems: false, // exclude items array (save memory)
maxItemsInCluster: 10, // limit the maximum number of items
  }}
>
```

### 3. Marker memoization

```tsx
const markerElements = useMemo(
  () => markers.map((m) => <Marker key={m.id} position={m.position} item={m} />),
  [markers]
);

<MarkerClusterer>{markerElements}</MarkerClusterer>;
```

## Custom Algorithm

You can create your own algorithm by implementing the `ClusterAlgorithm` interface:

```tsx
import type { ClusterAlgorithm, AlgorithmContext, ItemRecord, Cluster } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

class SimpleDistanceAlgorithm<TData> implements ClusterAlgorithm<TData> {
  private threshold: number;

  constructor(threshold = 0.01) {
    this.threshold = threshold;
  }

  cluster(items: readonly ItemRecord<TData>[], ctx: AlgorithmContext) {
    const clusters: Cluster<TData>[] = [];
    const visited = new Set<string>();

    items.forEach((item) => {
      if (visited.has(String(item.id))) return;

      const nearby: ItemRecord<TData>[] = [item];
      visited.add(String(item.id));

      items.forEach((other) => {
        if (visited.has(String(other.id))) return;

        const distance = Math.sqrt(
          Math.pow(item.position.lat - other.position.lat, 2) +
            Math.pow(item.position.lng - other.position.lng, 2)
        );

        if (distance < this.threshold) {
          nearby.push(other);
          visited.add(String(other.id));
        }
      });

      if (nearby.length > 1) {
        clusters.push({
          id: `cluster-${item.id}`,
          position: {
            lat: nearby.reduce((sum, i) => sum + i.position.lat, 0) / nearby.length,
            lng: nearby.reduce((sum, i) => sum + i.position.lng, 0) / nearby.length
          },
          count: nearby.length,
          items: nearby
        });
      }
    });

    return { clusters, points: [] };
  }
}

<MarkerClusterer algorithm={new SimpleDistanceAlgorithm()}>...</MarkerClusterer>;
```

## Summary of Props

| Prop | Type | default | Description |
| ---------------- | -------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| `algorithm` | `BuiltInAlgorithm\| ClusterAlgorithm` | `{ type: "supercluster", radius: 60 }` | Clustering Algorithm |
| `clusterIcon` | `(args) => ReactNode` | Basic blue circle | Cluster Icon Renderer |
| `onClusterClick` | `(args) => void` | - | Cluster Click Handler |
| `behavior` | `{ recomputeOn, debounceMs }` | `{ recomputeOn: "idle", debounceMs: 200 }` | Action settings |
| `clusterData` | `{ includeItems, maxItemsInCluster }` | `{ includeItems: true }` | Data Inclusion Settings |
| `enabled` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable Clustering |

## Next steps

- [MarkerClusterer API](/api/marker-clusterer) - Full list of Props
- [Marker examples](/examples/markers) - How to use basic markers

---

## Source File: examples/data-layer.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/data-layer
- Local Path: packages/docs/examples/data-layer.md

# data layer

Describes how to display various geographic data files on a map using `GeoJson`, `Gpx`, and `Kmz` components.

## Live Demo

### GeoJSON

<DemoEmbed demo="geojson" height="400px" />

### GPX

<DemoEmbed demo="gpx" height="400px" />

## GeoJSON rendering

Render GeoJSON data declaratively:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, GeoJson, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function GeoJsonExample() {
  const geojson = {
    type: "FeatureCollection",
    features: [
      {
        type: "Feature",
properties: { name: "Central Seoul" },
        geometry: {
          type: "Polygon",
          coordinates: [
            [
              [126.97, 37.57],
              [126.99, 37.57],
              [126.99, 37.56],
              [126.97, 37.56],
              [126.97, 37.57]
            ]
          ]
        }
      }
    ]
  };

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.566, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={13}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <GeoJson
          data={geojson}
          style={{
            strokeColor: "#4285F4",
            strokeWeight: 2,
            fillColor: "#4285F4",
            fillOpacity: 0.3
          }}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Load external GeoJSON file

```tsx
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { NaverMap, GeoJson, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";
import type { GeoJsonProps } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function ExternalGeoJsonExample() {
  const [data, setData] = useState<GeoJsonProps["data"] | null>(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch("/seoul.geojson")
      .then((res) => res.json())
      .then(setData);
  }, []);

  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.566, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={11}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        {data && (
          <GeoJson
            data={data}
            style={{ strokeColor: "#03C75A", fillColor: "#03C75A", fillOpacity: 0.2 }}
          />
        )}
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Styling by Feature

You can apply different styles to each Feature by passing a function to `style`:

```tsx
<GeoJson
  data={geojson}
  style={(feature) => {
    const population = feature.getProperty("population");
    return {
      fillColor: population > 500000 ? "#FF0000" : "#00FF00",
      fillOpacity: 0.4,
      strokeWeight: 1
    };
  }}
/>
```

## GPX rendering

If you pass a GPX file URL, it will automatically fetch and display the path:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Gpx, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function GpxExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.55, lng: 127.0 }}
        zoom={11}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Gpx
          url="/bicycle.gpx"
          style={{
            strokeColor: "#FF5722",
            strokeWeight: 3,
            strokeOpacity: 0.9
          }}
          onFeaturesAdded={(features) => {
console.log(`${features.length} features loaded`);
          }}
          onDataError={(err) => {
console.error("GPX load failed:", err.message);
          }}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## KMZ rendering

KMZ files are ZIP compressed KML files. Just pass a URL and it will automatically handle downloading, unzipping, and KML parsing:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, Kmz, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function KmzExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.566, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={8}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      >
        <Kmz
          url="/airspace.kmz"
          style={{
            strokeColor: "#9C27B0",
            strokeWeight: 2,
            fillColor: "#9C27B0",
            fillOpacity: 0.3
          }}
          onFeaturesAdded={(features) => {
console.log(`${features.length} features loaded`);
          }}
        />
      </NaverMap>
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

## Control data with Ref

```tsx
import { useRef } from "react";
import { NaverMap, GeoJson, NaverMapProvider, type GeoJsonRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function DataControlExample() {
  const geoJsonRef = useRef<GeoJsonRef>(null);

  const handleExport = () => {
    const exported = geoJsonRef.current?.toGeoJson();
console.log("Export GeoJSON:", exported);
  };

  const handleListFeatures = () => {
    const features = geoJsonRef.current?.getAllFeature();
    features?.forEach((feature) => {
      console.log(`Feature: ${feature.getId()}`);
    });
  };

  const handleHighlight = () => {
    const feature = geoJsonRef.current?.getFeatureById("my-feature");
    if (feature) {
      geoJsonRef.current?.overrideStyle(feature, {
        fillColor: "#FF0000",
        fillOpacity: 0.6
      });
    }
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          center={{ lat: 37.566, lng: 126.978 }}
          zoom={13}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        >
          <GeoJson ref={geoJsonRef} data={geojson} />
        </NaverMap>
      </NaverMapProvider>

      <div>
<button onClick={handleExport}>Export GeoJSON</button>
<button onClick={handleListFeatures}>Feature List</button>
<button onClick={handleHighlight}>Highlight</button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Next steps

- [GeoJson API](/api/geo-json) - GeoJson All Props
- [Gpx API](/api/gpx) - Gpx All Props
- [Kmz API](/api/kmz) - Kmz All Props
- [Draw shapes](/examples/shapes) - Overlay shapes such as Circle, Polygon, etc.

---

## Source File: examples/controls.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/examples/controls
- Local Path: packages/docs/examples/controls.md

# map control

Explains how to set controls such as zoom, type, and scale of the map.

## Live Demo

<DemoEmbed demo="navermap" height="450px" />

## Zoom control

Show zoom in/out buttons:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function ZoomControlExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        zoomControl
        zoomControlOptions={{
          position: naver.maps.Position.TOP_RIGHT,
          style: naver.maps.ZoomControlStyle.SMALL
        }}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Zoom control options

| Options | Description |
| ---------- | -------------------------------- |
| `position` | Control Location |
| `style` | control style (`SMALL`, `LARGE`) |

### Zoom range limitations

```tsx
<NaverMap minZoom={6} maxZoom={18} zoomControl />
```

## Map type control

Normal map, satellite map, hybrid conversion:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function MapTypeControlExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        mapTypeControl
        mapTypeControlOptions={{
          position: naver.maps.Position.TOP_RIGHT,
          mapTypeIds: [
            naver.maps.MapTypeId.NORMAL,
            naver.maps.MapTypeId.TERRAIN,
            naver.maps.MapTypeId.SATELLITE,
            naver.maps.MapTypeId.HYBRID
          ]
        }}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### Map type

| Type | Description |
| ----------- | ------------------ |
| `NORMAL` | Normal map (default) |
| `TERRAIN` | topographic map |
| `SATELLITE` | satellite map |
| `HYBRID` | satellite + map information |

## Scale Control

Show map scale:

```tsx
<NaverMap
  scaleControl
  scaleControlOptions={{
    position: naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_LEFT
  }}
/>
```

## Logo Control

Naver logo display status:

```tsx
<NaverMap
  logoControl
  logoControlOptions={{
    position: naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_RIGHT
  }}
/>
```

## Map data control

Display map data (road names, building names, etc.):

```tsx
<NaverMap
  mapDataControl
  mapDataControlOptions={{
    position: naver.maps.Position.BOTTOM_LEFT
  }}
/>
```

## Interaction Control

User input control:

```tsx
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function InteractionControlExample() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
      <NaverMap
        center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
        zoom={12}
        style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
// drag
        draggable={true}
// scroll wheel zoom
        scrollWheel={true}
// pinch zoom (mobile)
        pinchZoom={true}
// keyboard shortcuts
        keyboardShortcuts={false}
// Disable double click zoom
        disableDoubleClickZoom={true}
// Disable double tap zoom (mobile)
        disableDoubleTapZoom={false}
// Disable inertial scrolling
        disableKineticPan={false}
      />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

| Prop | default | Description |
| ------------------------ | ------- | -------------------- |
| `draggable` | `true` | Move by dragging |
| `scrollWheel` | `true` | Zoom with wheel |
| `pinchZoom` | `true` | Pinch to zoom |
| `keyboardShortcuts` | `true` | keyboard movement |
| `disableDoubleClickZoom` | `false` | Disable double click zoom |

## Limit movement range

Limit map movement to specific areas:

```tsx
<NaverMap
  maxBounds={{
south: 33.0, // South Korea area
    west: 124.0,
    north: 39.0,
    east: 132.0
  }}
/>
```

## Custom Control (using Ref)

Control the map by creating your own control buttons:

```tsx
import { useRef, useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider, type NaverMapRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function CustomControls() {
  const mapRef = useRef<NaverMapRef>(null);
  const [mapType, setMapType] = useState("normal");

  const zoomIn = () => {
    const currentZoom = mapRef.current?.getZoom() ?? 12;
    mapRef.current?.setZoom(currentZoom + 1);
  };

  const zoomOut = () => {
    const currentZoom = mapRef.current?.getZoom() ?? 12;
    mapRef.current?.setZoom(currentZoom - 1);
  };

  const changeMapType = (type: string) => {
    mapRef.current?.setMapTypeId(type);
    setMapType(type);
  };

  const goToSeoul = () => {
    mapRef.current?.panTo({ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 });
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <div style={{ marginBottom: "1rem", display: "flex", gap: "0.5rem" }}>
        <button onClick={zoomIn}>+</button>
        <button onClick={zoomOut}>-</button>
<button onClick={goToSeoul}>Go to Seoul</button>
<button onClick={() => changeMapType("normal")}>Normal</button>
<button onClick={() => changeMapType("satellite")}>Satellite</button>
<button onClick={() => changeMapType("terrain")}>Terrain</button>
      </div>

      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          ref={mapRef}
          center={{ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 }}
          zoom={12}
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "400px" }}
        />
      </NaverMapProvider>

<p>Current map type: {mapType}</p>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Complete control example

```tsx
import { useRef, useState } from "react";
import { NaverMap, NaverMapProvider, type NaverMapRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

function FullControlExample() {
  const mapRef = useRef<NaverMapRef>(null);
  const [center, setCenter] = useState({ lat: 37.5665, lng: 126.978 });
  const [zoom, setZoom] = useState(12);

  return (
    <div>
      <NaverMapProvider ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}>
        <NaverMap
          ref={mapRef}
          center={center}
          zoom={zoom}
          onCenterChanged={setCenter}
          onZoomChanged={setZoom}
          minZoom={6}
          maxZoom={18}
          zoomControl
          mapTypeControl
          scaleControl
          style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }}
        />
      </NaverMapProvider>

      <div style={{ marginTop: "1rem" }}>
        <p>
Center coordinates: {center.lat.toFixed(4)}, {center.lng.toFixed(4)}
        </p>
<p>Zoom level: {zoom}</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Next steps

- [NaverMap API](/api/map) - Full list of Props
- [Ref API](/api/map#ref-method) - Map control method

---

## Source File: troubleshooting/common-issues.md

- URL: https://react-naver-maps-kit.pages.dev/troubleshooting/common-issues
- Local Path: packages/docs/troubleshooting/common-issues.md

# Frequently Asked Questions

## Installation and setup

### SDK is stuck loading (state does not change from `loading`)

**Cause**: SDK script loading failure

**Make sure**:

1. Make sure your API key is correct
2. Check if your current domain is whitelisted
3. Check for network errors in your browser console

```tsx
<NaverMapProvider
  ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}
onError={(error) => console.error("SDK loading failed:", error)}
>
```

**Development environment domain settings**:

```
http://localhost:5173
http://localhost:3000
http://127.0.0.1:5173
```

### 401 authentication error occurred

**Cause**: API key or domain mismatch

**Solution**:

1. Check key type in Naver Cloud Platform console
2. Recommended to use `ncpKeyId` (instead of legacy `ncpClientId`)
3. Domain includes `http://` or `https://` protocol

### I want to reload the SDK

```tsx
function MyComponent() {
  const { reloadSdk } = useNaverMap();

  const handleReload = async () => {
    await reloadSdk();
  };

return <button onClick={handleReload}>Reload SDK</button>;
}
```

## Show map

### The map is not visible on the screen

**Make sure**:

1. **Make sure the height is specified**

```tsx
// ❌ Wrong - no height
<NaverMap center={...} style={{ width: "100%" }} />

// ✅ Correct - specify height
<NaverMap center={...} style={{ width: "100%", height: "500px" }} />
```

2. **Check if parent container has height**

```tsx
// If the parent has a height, height: 100% is also possible
<div style={{ height: "100vh" }}>
  <NaverMap style={{ width: "100%", height: "100%" }} />
</div>
```

### The map is gray

**Cause**: CSS conflict or container size issue

**Solution**:

- Add `position: relative` to map container
- Remove `overflow: hidden` from parent element

## Use Hook

### "useNaverMap must be used within a NaverMapProvider" error

**Cause**: Hook call outside of Provider

**Solution**:

```tsx
// ❌ Wrong
function MyComponent() {
const { map } = useNaverMap(); // Outside Provider
  return <div>...</div>;
}

function App() {
return <MyComponent />; // Not wrapped in Provider
}

// ✅ Correct
function App() {
  return (
    <NaverMapProvider>
      <MyComponent />
    </NaverMapProvider>
  );
}
```

### map is null

**Cause**: SDK not yet ready

**Solution**:

```tsx
function MyComponent() {
  const { sdkStatus, map } = useNaverMap();

// Check if SDK is ready
  if (sdkStatus !== "ready") {
return <div>Loading...</div>;
  }

// use map
return <div>Ready!</div>;
}
```

## Markers and overlays

### Marker is not displayed

**Make sure**:

1. **Make sure you are inside NaverMap**

```tsx
// ❌ Wrong
<NaverMap />
<Marker position={...} /> // Outside the map

// ✅ Correct
<NaverMap>
  <Marker position={...} />
</NaverMap>
```

2. **Check that the coordinates are correct**

```tsx
// Korean coordinate range
// latitude: 33 to 39
// Hardness: 124 ~ 132
<Marker position={{ lat: 37.5, lng: 127.0 }} />
```

3. **Check visible prop**

```tsx
<Marker position={...} visible={true} />
```

### Custom markers are cut off

**Cause**: anchor point not set

**Solution**:

```tsx
<Marker
  position={...}
  icon={{
    content: '<div style="width:40px;height:40px">📍</div>',
anchor: new naver.maps.Point(20, 40), // bottom center
  }}
/>
```

### InfoWindow does not close

```tsx
function MyComponent() {
  const infoRef = useRef<InfoWindowRef>(null);

  const closeInfo = () => {
    infoRef.current?.close();
  };

  return (
    <InfoWindow ref={infoRef} visible>
<button onClick={closeInfo}>Close</button>
    </InfoWindow>
  );
}
```

## Clustering

### MarkerClusterer not working

**Make sure**:

1. **Check if clustererItemId exists** (Required!)

```tsx
<MarkerClusterer>
  {markers.map((m) => (
    <Marker
      key={m.id}
clustererItemId={m.id} // ← Required!
      position={m.position}
    />
  ))}
</MarkerClusterer>
```

2. **Make sure you are inside NaverMap**

```tsx
<NaverMap>
  <MarkerClusterer>...</MarkerClusterer>
</NaverMap>
```

### Cluster icon is broken

**Cause**: CSS style conflict

**Solution**:

```tsx
<MarkerClusterer
  clusterIcon={({ count }) => (
    <div
      style={{
        width: 50,
        height: 50,
        borderRadius: "50%",
        display: "flex",
        alignItems: "center",
        justifyContent: "center",
// specify box-sizing
        boxSizing: "border-box",
      }}
    >
      {count}
    </div>
  )}
>
```

## TypeScript

### "Cannot find namespace 'naver'" error

**Cause**: No Naver map type definition

**Solution**:

```bash
pnpm add -D @types/naver-maps
```

Or add to `global.d.ts`:

```ts
declare namespace naver {
  namespace maps {
    // ...
  }
}
```

### Props type error

```tsx
import type { NaverMapProps, MarkerProps, NaverMapRef, MarkerRef } from "react-naver-maps-kit";

const mapRef = useRef<NaverMapRef>(null);
const markerProps: MarkerProps = {
  position: { lat: 37.5, lng: 127.0 }
};
```

## Performance

### Slow when there are many markers

**Solution**:

1. **Use MarkerClusterer**

```tsx
<MarkerClusterer>
  {markers.map(...)}
</MarkerClusterer>
```

2. **Marker Memoization**

```tsx
const markerElements = useMemo(
  () => markers.map((m) => <Marker key={m.id} position={m.position} />),
  [markers]
);
```

3. **Prevent unnecessary re-rendering**

```tsx
const handleMarkerClick = useCallback((e) => {
  console.log(e.coord);
}, []); // Minimize dependencies
```

### A memory leak occurs

**Make sure**:

- The event listener is automatically released when the component is unmounted.
- Instances saved as Ref do not need to be cleaned up directly.
- `MarkerClusterer` is automatically cleaned up when unmounted.

## etc

### An error occurs when using Next.js

**Cause**: Accessing window object in SSR

**Solution**:

```tsx
// use dynamic import
import dynamic from "next/dynamic";

const NaverMap = dynamic(() => import("react-naver-maps-kit").then((mod) => mod.NaverMap), {
  ssr: false
});
```

### Environment variable is not recognized

**Vite**:

```env
VITE_NCP_KEY_ID=your-key
```

```tsx
ncpKeyId={import.meta.env.VITE_NCP_KEY_ID}
```

**Create React App**:

```env
REACT_APP_NCP_KEY_ID=your-key
```

```tsx
ncpKeyId={process.env.REACT_APP_NCP_KEY_ID}
```

**Next.js**:

```env
NEXT_PUBLIC_NCP_KEY_ID=your-key
```

```tsx
ncpKeyId={process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_NCP_KEY_ID}
```

## Can't solve your problem?

Please register an issue at [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/cobocho/react-naver-maps-kit/issues). Please include the following information to help speed resolution:

- Version in use (`react-naver-maps-kit`, `react`)
- Browser and version
- Minimum reproducible example
- Console error message

---
